Text

Chapter I The Science of Deduction

[Sherlock Holmes]105-holmes took [his]105-holmes bottle from the corner of the mantel - piece and [his]105-holmes hypodermic syringe from its neat morocco case . With [his]105-holmes long , white , nervous fingers [he]105-holmes adjusted the delicate needle , and rolled back [his]105-holmes left shirt - cuff . For some little time [his]105-holmes eyes rested thoughtfully upon the sinewy forearm and wrist all dotted and scarred with innumerable puncture - marks . Finally [he]105-holmes thrust the sharp point home , pressed down the tiny piston , and sank back into the velvet - lined arm - chair with a long sigh of satisfaction .

Three times a day for many months [I]0-i had witnessed this performance , but custom had not reconciled [my]0-i mind to it . On the contrary , from day to day [I]0-i had become more irritable at the sight , and [my]0-i conscience swelled nightly within [me]0-i at the thought that [I]0-i had lacked the courage to protest . Again and again [I]0-i had registered a vow that [I]0-i should deliver [my]0-i soul upon the subject , but there was that in the cool , nonchalant air of [[my]0-i companion]195-my companion which made [him]105-holmes [the last man with whom one would care to take anything approaching to a liberty]196-the last man with whom one would care to take anything approaching to a liberty . [His]105-holmes great powers , [his]105-holmes masterly manner , and the experience which [I]0-i had had of [his]105-holmes many extraordinary qualities , all made [me]0-i diffident and backward in crossing [him]105-holmes .

Yet upon that afternoon , whether it was the Beaune which [I]0-i had taken with [my]0-i lunch , or the additional exasperation produced by the extreme deliberation of [his]105-holmes manner , [I]0-i suddenly felt that [I]0-i could hold out no longer .

" Which is it to - day ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , " morphine or cocaine ? "[0-i]

[He]105-holmes raised [his]105-holmes eyes languidly from the old black - letter volume which [he]105-holmes had opened . " It is cocaine , "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes said , " a seven - per - cent . solution . Would [you]0-i care to try it ? "[105-holmes]

" No , indeed , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , brusquely . " [My]0-i constitution has not got over the Afghan campaign yet . [I]0-i can not afford to throw any extra strain upon it . "[0-i]

[He]105-holmes smiled at [my]0-i vehemence . " Perhaps [you]0-i are right , [Watson]106-watson , "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes said . " [I]105-holmes suppose that its influence is physically a bad one . [I]105-holmes find it , however , so transcendently stimulating and clarifying to the mind that its secondary action is a matter of small moment . "[105-holmes]

" But consider ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said , earnestly . " Count the cost ! [Your]0-i brain may , as [you]0-i say , be roused and excited , but it is a pathological and morbid process , which involves increased tissue - change and may at last leave a permanent weakness . [You]0-i know , too , what a black reaction comes upon [you]0-i . Surely the game is hardly worth the candle . Why should [you]0-i , for a mere passing pleasure , risk the loss of those great powers with which [you]0-i have been endowed ? Remember that [I]0-i speak not only as [one comrade]702-one comrade to [another]703-another , but as [a medical man to one for whose constitution [he]105-holmes is to some extent answerable]704-a medical man to one for whose constitution he is to some extent answerable . "[0-i]

[He]105-holmes did not seem offended . On the contrary , [he]105-holmes put [his]105-holmes finger - tips together and leaned [his]105-holmes elbows on the arms of [his]105-holmes chair , like [one who has a relish for conversation]197-one who has a relish for conversation .

" [My]105-holmes mind , "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes said , " rebels at stagnation . Give [me]105-holmes problems , give [me]105-holmes work , give [me]105-holmes the most abstruse cryptogram or the most intricate analysis , and [I]105-holmes am in [my]105-holmes own proper atmosphere . [I]105-holmes can dispense then with artificial stimulants . But [I]105-holmes abhor the dull routine of existence . [I]105-holmes crave for mental exaltation . That is why [I]105-holmes have chosen [my]105-holmes own particular profession , or rather created it , for [I]105-holmes am [the only one in [the world]706-the world]705-the only one in the world . "[105-holmes]

" [The only unofficial detective]707-the only unofficial detective ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said , raising [my]0-i eyebrows .

" [The only unofficial consulting detective]708-the only unofficial consulting detective , "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes answered . " [I]105-holmes am [the last and highest court of appeal in detection]709-the last and highest court of appeal in detection . When [Gregson]107-gregson or [Lestrade]108-lestrade or [Athelney Jones]109-jones are out of [their]710-their depths which , by the way , is [their]710-their normal state the matter is laid before [me]105-holmes . [I]105-holmes examine the data , as [an expert]711-an expert , and pronounce [a specialist]712-a specialist s opinion . [I]105-holmes claim no credit in such cases . [My]105-holmes name figures in no newspaper . The work itself , the pleasure of finding a field for [my]105-holmes peculiar powers , is [my]105-holmes highest reward . But [you]713-you have [yourself]713-you had some experience of [my]105-holmes methods of work in the Jefferson Hope case . "[105-holmes]

" Yes , indeed , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , cordially . " [I]0-i was never so struck by anything in [my]0-i life . [I]0-i even embodied it in a small brochure with the somewhat fantastic title of A Study in [Scarlet]1-scarlet . "[0-i]

[He]198-i shook [his]198-i head sadly . " [I]198-i glanced over it , "[198-i] said [he]198-i . " Honestly , [I]198-i can not congratulate [you]713-you upon it . Detection is , or ought to be , an exact science , and should be treated in the same cold and unemotional manner . [You]713-you have attempted to tinge it with romanticism , which produces much the same effect as if [you]713-you worked a love - story or an elopement into the fifth proposition of Euclid . "[198-i]

" But the romance was there , "[0-i] [I]0-i remonstrated . " [I]0-i could not tamper with the facts . "[0-i]

" Some facts should be suppressed , or at least a just sense of proportion should be observed in treating them . The only point in the case which deserved mention was the curious analytical reasoning from effects to causes by which [I]198-i succeeded in unraveling it . "[198-i]

[I]0-i was annoyed at this criticism of a work which had been specially designed to please [him]198-i . [I]0-i confess , too , that [I]0-i was irritated by the egotism which seemed to demand that every line of [my]0-i pamphlet should be devoted to [his]198-i own special doings . More than once during the years that [I]0-i had lived with [him]198-i in [Baker Street]199-baker street [I]0-i had observed that a small vanity underlay [[my]0-i companion]195-my companion s quiet and didactic manner . [I]0-i made no remark , however , but sat nursing [my]0-i wounded leg . [I]0-i had a Jezail bullet through it some time before , and , though it did not prevent [me]0-i from walking , it ached wearily at every change of the weather .

" [My]105-holmes practice has extended recently to [the Continent]2-the continent , "[105-holmes] said [Holmes]105-holmes , after a while , filling up [his]105-holmes old brier - root pipe . " [I]105-holmes was consulted last week by [Fran ois Le Villard]110-fran ois le villard , who , as [you]714-you probably know , has come rather to the front lately in [the French detective service]715-the french detective service . [He]110-fran ois le villard has all the Celtic power of quick intuition , but [he]110-fran ois le villard is deficient in the wide range of exact knowledge which is essential to the higher developments of [his]110-fran ois le villard art . The case was concerned with a will , and possessed some features of interest . [I]105-holmes was able to refer [him]105-holmes to two parallel cases , the one at [Riga]3-riga in 1857 , and the other at [St. Louis]4-st. louis in 1871 , which have suggested to [him]105-holmes the true solution . Here is the letter which [I]105-holmes had this morning acknowledging [my]105-holmes assistance . "[105-holmes] [He]105-holmes tossed over , as [he]105-holmes spoke , a crumpled sheet of foreign notepaper . [I]0-i glanced [my]0-i eyes down it , catching a profusion of notes of admiration , with stray " magnifiques , "[0-i] " coup - de - ma tres , "[0-i] and " tours - de - force , "[0-i] all testifying to the ardent admiration of [the Frenchman]201-the frenchman .

" [He]105-holmes speaks as [a pupil to [[his]105-holmes master]717-his master]716-a pupil to his master , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" Oh , [he]105-holmes rates [my]105-holmes assistance too highly , "[105-holmes] said [Sherlock Holmes]105-holmes , lightly . " [He]105-holmes has considerable gifts [himself]105-holmes . [He]105-holmes possesses two out of the three qualities necessary for [the ideal detective]718-the ideal detective . [He]105-holmes has the power of observation and that of deduction . [He]105-holmes is only wanting in knowledge ; and that may come in time . [He]105-holmes is now translating [my]105-holmes small works into French . "[105-holmes]

" [Your]105-holmes works ? "[0-i]

" Oh , didn t [you]0-i know ? "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes cried , laughing . " Yes , [I]105-holmes have been guilty of several monographs . They are all upon technical subjects . Here , for example , is one Upon the Distinction between the Ashes of the Various Tobaccoes . In it [I]105-holmes enumerate a hundred and forty forms of cigar- , cigarette- , and pipe - tobacco , with coloured plates illustrating the difference in the ash . It is a point which is continually turning up in criminal trials , and which is sometimes of supreme importance as a clue . If [you]719-you can say definitely , for example , that some murder has been done by [a man who was smoking an Indian lunkah]720-a man who was smoking an indian lunkah , it obviously narrows [your]719-you field of search . To the trained eye there is as much difference between the black ash of a Trichinopoly and the white fluff of bird s - eye as there is between a cabbage and a potato . "[105-holmes]

" [You]105-holmes have an extraordinary genius for minuti , "[0-i] [I]0-i remarked .

" [I]105-holmes appreciate their importance . Here is [my]105-holmes monograph upon the tracing of footsteps , with some remarks upon the uses of plaster of [Paris]5-paris as a preserver of impresses . Here , too , is a curious little work upon the influence of a trade upon the form of the hand , with lithotypes of the hands of [slaters]721-slaters , [sailors]722-sailors , [corkcutters]723-corkcutters , [compositors]724-compositors , [weavers]725-weavers , and [diamond - polishers]726-diamond - polishers . That is a matter of great practical interest to [the scientific detective , especially in cases of unclaimed bodies]727-the scientific detective , especially in cases of unclaimed bodies , or in discovering the antecedents of [criminals]728-criminals . But [I]105-holmes weary [you]105-holmes with [my]105-holmes hobby . "[105-holmes]

" Not at all , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , earnestly . " It is of the greatest interest to [me]0-i , especially since [I]0-i have had the opportunity of observing [your]105-holmes practical application of it . But [you]105-holmes spoke just now of observation and deduction . Surely the one to some extent implies the other . "[0-i]

" Why , hardly , "[202-i] [he]202-i answered , leaning back luxuriously in [his]202-i arm - chair , and sending up thick blue wreaths from [his]202-i pipe . " For example , observation shows [me]202-i that [you]105-holmes have been to [the Wigmore Street Post - Office]729-the wigmore street post - office this morning , but deduction lets [me]202-i know that when there [you]105-holmes dispatched a telegram . "[202-i]

" Right ! "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " Right on both points ! But [I]202-i confess that [I]202-i don t see how [you]105-holmes arrived at it . It was a sudden impulse upon [my]202-i part , and [I]202-i have mentioned it to [no one]730-no one . "[202-i]

" It is simplicity itself , "[202-i] [he]202-i remarked , chuckling at [my]0-i surprise , " so absurdly simple that an explanation is superfluous ; and yet it may serve to define the limits of observation and of deduction . Observation tells [me]202-i that [you]105-holmes have a little reddish mould adhering to [your]105-holmes instep . Just opposite [the Seymour Street Office]731-the seymour street office [they]732-they have taken up [the pavement]733-the pavement and thrown up some earth which lies in such a way that it is difficult to avoid treading in it in entering . The earth is of this peculiar reddish tint which is found , as far as [I]202-i know , nowhere else in [the neighbourhood]734-the neighbourhood . So much is observation . The rest is deduction . "[202-i]

" How , then , did [you]202-i deduce the telegram ? "[202-i]

" Why , of course [I]202-i knew that [you]105-holmes had not written a letter , since [I]202-i sat opposite to [you]105-holmes all morning . [I]202-i see also in [your]105-holmes open desk there that [you]105-holmes have a sheet of stamps and a thick bundle of post - cards . What could [you]105-holmes go into [the post - office]735-the post - office for , then , but to send a wire ? Eliminate all other factors , and the one which remains must be the truth . "[202-i]

" In this case it certainly is so , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied , after a little thought . " The thing , however , is , as [you]203-you say , of the simplest . Would [you]203-you think [me]0-i impertinent if [I]0-i were to put [your]105-holmes theories to a more severe test ? "[0-i]

" On the contrary , "[203-you] [he]203-you answered , " it would prevent [me]203-you from taking a second dose of cocaine . [I]203-you should be delighted to look into any problem which [you]0-i might submit to [me]203-you . "[203-you]

" [I]0-i have heard [you]203-you say that it is difficult for [a man]736-a man to have any object in daily use without leaving the impress of [his]736-a man individuality upon it in such a way that [a trained observer]737-a trained observer might read it . Now , [I]0-i have here a watch which has recently come into [my]0-i possession . Would [you]203-you have the kindness to let [me]0-i have an opinion upon the character or habits of [the late owner]738-the late owner ? "[0-i]

[I]0-i handed [him]203-you over the watch with some slight feeling of amusement in [my]0-i heart , for the test was , as [I]0-i thought , an impossible one , and [I]0-i intended it as a lesson against the somewhat dogmatic tone which [he]203-you occasionally assumed . [He]203-you balanced the watch in [his]203-you hand , gazed hard at the dial , opened the back , and examined the works , first with [his]203-you naked eyes and then with a powerful convex lens . [I]0-i could hardly keep from smiling at [his]203-you crestfallen face when [he]203-you finally snapped the case to and handed it back .

" There are hardly any data , "[203-you] [he]203-you remarked . " The watch has been recently cleaned , which robs [me]203-you of [my]203-you most suggestive facts . "[203-you]

" [You]203-you are right , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " It was cleaned before being sent to [me]0-i . "[0-i] In [my]0-i heart [I]0-i accused [[my]0-i companion]195-my companion of putting forward a most lame and impotent excuse to cover [his]203-you failure . What data could [he]203-you expect from an uncleaned watch ?

" Though unsatisfactory , [my]203-you research has not been entirely barren , "[203-you] [he]203-you observed , staring up at the ceiling with dreamy , lack - lustre eyes . " Subject to [your]203-you correction , [I]203-you should judge that the watch belonged to [[your]203-you elder brother]739-your elder brother , who inherited it from [[your]203-you father]740-your father . "[203-you]

" That [you]203-you gather , no doubt , from the H. W. upon the back ? "[203-you]

" Quite so . The W. suggests [your]203-you own name . The date of the watch is nearly fifty years back , and the initials are as old as the watch : so it was made for the last generation . [Jewelry]111-jewelry usually descends to [the eldest son]741-the eldest son , and [he]741-the eldest son is most likely to have the same name as [the father]742-the father . [[Your]203-you father]740-your father has , if [I]203-you remember right , been dead many years . It has , therefore , been in the hands of [[your]203-you eldest brother]744-your eldest brother . "[203-you]

" Right , so far , "[205-i.] said [I.]205-i. " Anything else ? "[203-you]

" [He]744-your eldest brother was [a man of untidy habits , very untidy and careless]745-a man of untidy habits , very untidy and careless . [He]744-your eldest brother was left with good prospects , but [he]744-your eldest brother threw away [his]744-your eldest brother chances , lived for some time in poverty with occasional short intervals of prosperity , and finally , taking to drink , [he]744-your eldest brother died . That is all [I]205-i. can gather . "[205-i.]

[I]0-i sprang from [my]0-i chair and limped impatiently about [the room]206-the room with considerable bitterness in [my]0-i heart .

" This is unworthy of [you]203-you , [Holmes]105-holmes , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [I]0-i could not have believed that [you]203-you would have descended to this . [You]203-you have made inquires into the history of [[my]0-i unhappy brother]746-my unhappy brother , and [you]203-you now pretend to deduce this knowledge in some fanciful way . [You]203-you can not expect [me]0-i to believe that [you]203-you have read all this from [his]746-my unhappy brother old watch ! It is unkind , and , to speak plainly , has a touch of charlatanism in it . "[0-i]

" [[My]207-i dear doctor]747-my dear doctor , "[207-i] said [he]207-i , kindly , " pray accept [my]207-i apologies . Viewing the matter as an abstract problem , [I]207-i had forgotten how personal and painful a thing it might be to [you]203-you . [I]207-i assure [you]203-you , however , that [I]207-i never even knew that [you]203-you had [a brother]748-a brother until [you]203-you handed [me]207-i the watch . "[207-i]

" Then how in the name of all that is wonderful did [you]203-you get these facts ? They are absolutely correct in every particular . "[0-i]

" Ah , that is good luck . [I]207-i could only say what was the balance of probability . [I]207-i did not at all expect to be so accurate . "[207-i]

" But it was not mere guess - work ? "[0-i]

" No , no : [I]207-i never guess . It is a shocking habit , destructive to [the logical faculty]749-the logical faculty . What seems strange to [you]203-you is only so because [you]203-you do not follow [my]207-i train of thought or observe the small facts upon which large inferences may depend . For example , [I]207-i began by stating that [[your]203-you brother]750-your brother was careless . When [you]203-you observe the lower part of that watch - case [you]203-you notice that it is not only dinted in two places , but it is cut and marked all over from the habit of keeping other hard objects , such as coins or keys , in the same pocket . Surely it is no great feat to assume that [a man who treats a fifty - guinea watch so cavalierly]751-a man who treats a fifty - guinea watch so cavalierly must be [a careless man]752-a careless man . Neither is it a very far - fetched inference that [a man who inherits one article of such value]753-a man who inherits one article of such value is pretty well provided for in other respects . "[207-i]

[I]0-i nodded , to show that [I]0-i followed [his]208-his reasoning .

" It is very customary for [pawnbrokers]754-pawnbrokers in [England]6-england , when [they]754-pawnbrokers take a watch , to scratch the number of the ticket with a pin - point upon the inside of the case . It is more handy than a label , as there is no risk of the number being lost or transposed . There are no less than four such numbers visible to [my]210-our landlady lens on the inside of this case . Inference , that [[your]203-you brother]750-your brother was often at low water . Secondary inference , that [he]750-your brother had occasional bursts of prosperity , or [he]750-your brother could not have redeemed the pledge . Finally , [I]210-our landlady ask [you]203-you to look at the inner plate , which contains the key - hole . Look at the thousands of scratches all round the hole , marks where the key has slipped . What [sober man]756-sober man s key could have scored those grooves ? But [you]203-you will never see [a drunkard]757-a drunkard s watch without them . [He]750-your brother winds it at night , and [he]750-your brother leaves these traces of [his]750-your brother unsteady hand . Where is the mystery in all this ? "[210-our landlady]

" It is as clear as daylight , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " [I]0-i regret the injustice which [I]0-i did [you]203-you . [I]0-i should have had more faith in [your]203-you marvellous faculty . May [I]0-i ask whether [you]203-you have any professional inquiry on foot at present ? "[0-i]

" None . Hence the cocaine . [I]210-our landlady can not live without brain - work . What else is there to live for ? Stand at the window here . Was ever such [a dreary , dismal , unprofitable world]758-a dreary , dismal , unprofitable world ? Chapter II The Statement of the Case

[Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan entered [the room]206-the room with a firm step and an outward composure of manner . [She]112-miss morstan was [a blonde young lady]213-a blonde young lady , small , dainty , well gloved , and dressed in the most perfect taste . There was , however , a plainness and simplicity about [her]112-miss morstan costume which bore with it a suggestion of limited means . The dress was a sombre greyish beige , untrimmed and unbraided , and [she]112-miss morstan wore a small turban of the same dull hue , relieved only by a suspicion of white feather in the side . [Her]112-miss morstan face had neither regularity of feature nor beauty of complexion , but [her]112-miss morstan expression was sweet and amiable , and [her]112-miss morstan large blue eyes were singularly spiritual and sympathetic . In an experience of women which extends over [many nations]214-many nations and [three separate continents]215-three separate continents , [I]0-i have never looked upon a face which gave a clearer promise of a refined and sensitive nature . [I]0-i could not but observe that as [she]112-miss morstan took the seat which [Sherlock Holmes]105-holmes placed for [her]112-miss morstan , [her]112-miss morstan lip trembled , [her]112-miss morstan hand quivered , and [she]112-miss morstan showed every sign of intense inward agitation .

" [I]112-miss morstan have come to [you]105-holmes , [Mr. Holmes]105-holmes , "[112-miss morstan] [she]112-miss morstan said , " because [you]105-holmes once enabled [[my]112-miss morstan employer]768-my employer , [Mrs. Cecil Forrester]114-mrs. cecil forrester , to unravel a little domestic complication . " [Mrs. Cecil Forrester]114-mrs. cecil forrester , "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes repeated thoughtfully . " [I]105-holmes believe that [I]105-holmes was of some slight service to [her]768-my employer . The case , however , as [I]105-holmes remember it , was a very simple one . "[105-holmes]

" [She]768-my employer did not think so . But at least [you]105-holmes can not say the same of [mine]105-holmes . [I]105-holmes can hardly imagine anything more strange , more utterly inexplicable , than the situation in which [I]105-holmes find [myself]105-holmes . "[105-holmes]

[Holmes]105-holmes rubbed [his]105-holmes hands , and [his]105-holmes eyes glistened . "[766-the young lady]

[I]0-i relapsed into [my]0-i chair .

" Briefly , "[766-the young lady] [she]766-the young lady continued , " the facts are these . [[My]766-the young lady father]770-my father was [an officer in [an Indian regiment who sent [me]766-the young lady [home]773-home when [I]766-the young lady was quite [a child]774-a child]772-an indian regiment who sent me home when i was quite a child . " A singular case , "[105-holmes] remarked [Holmes]105-holmes .

Chapter III In Quest of a Solution

It was half - past five before [Holmes]105-holmes returned . [He]105-holmes was bright , eager , and in excellent spirits , a mood which in [his]105-holmes case alternated with fits of the blackest depression .

" There is no great mystery in this matter , "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes said , taking the cup of tea which [I]0-i had poured out for [him]105-holmes . " The facts appear to admit of only one explanation . "[105-holmes]

" What ! [you]105-holmes have solved it already ? "[105-holmes]

" Well , that would be too much to say . [I]105-holmes have discovered a suggestive fact , that is all . It is , however , _ very _ suggestive . The details are still to be added . [I]105-holmes have just found , on consulting the back files of the _ Times _ , that [Major Sholto]116-major sholto , of Upper Norword , late of [the 34th Bombay Infantry]799-the 34th bombay infantry , died upon the 28th of April , 1882 . "[105-holmes]

" [I]105-holmes may be very obtuse , [Holmes]105-holmes , but [I]105-holmes fail to see what this suggests . "[105-holmes]

" No ? [You]105-holmes surprise [me]105-holmes . Look at it in this way , then . [Captain Morstan]115-captain morstan disappears . [The only person in [London]8-london whom [he]115-captain morstan could have visited]839-the only person in london whom he could have visited is [Major Sholto]116-major sholto . [Major Sholto]116-major sholto denies having heard that [he]116-major sholto was in [London]8-london . Four years later [Sholto]116-major sholto dies . _ Within a week of [his]116-major sholto death _ [[Captain Morstan]115-captain morstan s daughter]840-captain morstan s daughter receives a valuable present , which is repeated from year to year , and now culminates in a letter which describes [her]840-captain morstan s daughter as [a wronged woman]813-a wronged woman . What wrong can it refer to except this deprivation of [[her]840-captain morstan s daughter father]842-her father ? And why should the presents begin immediately after [Sholto]116-major sholto s death , unless it is that [[Sholto]116-major sholto s heir]843-sholto s heir knows something of the mystery and desires to make compensation ? Have [you]105-holmes any alternative theory which will meet the facts ? "[105-holmes]

" But what a strange compensation ! And how strangely made ! Why , too , should [he]116-major sholto write a letter now , rather than six years ago ? Again , the letter speaks of giving [her]840-captain morstan s daughter justice . What justice can [she]840-captain morstan s daughter have ? It is too much to suppose that [[her]840-captain morstan s daughter father]842-her father is still alive . There is no other injustice in [her]840-captain morstan s daughter case that [you]105-holmes know of . "[0-i]

" There are difficulties ; there are certainly difficulties , "[105-holmes] said [Sherlock Holmes]105-holmes , pensively . " But [our]845-our expedition of to - night will solve them all . Ah , here is [a four - wheeler]846-a four - wheeler , and [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan is inside . Are [you]105-holmes all ready ? Then [we]845-our had better go down , for it is a little past the hour . "[105-holmes]

[I]0-i picked up [my]0-i hat and [my]0-i heaviest stick , but [I]0-i observed that [Holmes]105-holmes took [his]105-holmes revolver from [his]105-holmes drawer and slipped it into [his]105-holmes pocket . It was clear that [he]105-holmes thought that [our]232-our night s work might be a serious one .

[Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan was muffled in a dark cloak , and [her]112-miss morstan sensitive face was composed , but pale . [She]112-miss morstan must have been more than [woman]233-woman if [she]112-miss morstan did not feel some uneasiness at the strange enterprise upon which [we]232-our were embarking , yet [her]112-miss morstan self - control was perfect , and [she]112-miss morstan readily answered the few additional questions which [Sherlock Holmes]105-holmes put to [her]112-miss morstan .

" [Major Sholto]116-major sholto was [a very particular friend of [papa s]848-papa s]847-a very particular friend of papa s , "[112-miss morstan] [she]112-miss morstan said . " [His]116-major sholto letters were full of allusions to [the major]800-the major . [He]116-major sholto and [papa]850-papa were in command of [the troops at [the Andaman Islands]852-the andaman islands]851-the troops at the andaman islands , so [they]853-they were thrown a great deal together . By the way , a curious paper was found in papa s desk which [no one]730-no one could understand . [I]112-miss morstan don t suppose that it is of the slightest importance , but [I]112-miss morstan thought [you]855-you might care to see it , so [I]112-miss morstan brought it with [me]112-miss morstan . It is here . "[112-miss morstan]

[Holmes]105-holmes unfolded the paper carefully and smoothed it out upon [his]105-holmes knee . [He]105-holmes then very methodically examined it all over with [his]105-holmes double lens .

" It is paper of native Indian manufacture , "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes remarked . " It has at some time been pinned to a board . The diagram upon it appears to be a plan of part of [a large building]856-a large building with [numerous halls]857-numerous halls , [corridors]858-corridors , and [passages]859-passages . At one point is a small cross done in red ink , and above it is 3.37 from left , in faded pencil - writing . In the left - hand corner is a curious hieroglyphic like four crosses in a line with [their]860-their arms touching . Beside it is written , in very rough and coarse characters , The sign of the four , [Jonathan Small]118-jonathan small , [Mahomet Singh]119-mahomet singh , [Abdullah Khan]120-abdullah khan , [Dost Akbar]121-dost akbar . No , [I]105-holmes confess that [I]105-holmes do not see how this bears upon the matter . Yet it is evidently a document of importance . It has been kept carefully in a pocket - book ; for the one side is as clean as the other . "[105-holmes]

" It was in [his]105-holmes pocket - book that [we]861-we found it . "[105-holmes]

" Preserve it carefully , then , [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan , for it may prove to be of use to [us]861-we . [I]105-holmes begin to suspect that this matter may turn out to be much deeper and more subtle than [I]105-holmes at first supposed . [I]105-holmes must reconsider [my]105-holmes ideas . "[105-holmes] [He]105-holmes leaned back in [the cab]234-the cab , and [I]0-i could see by [his]105-holmes drawn brow and [his]105-holmes vacant eye that [he]105-holmes was thinking intently . [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan and [I]0-i chatted in an undertone about [our]235-we present expedition and its possible outcome , but [[our]235-we companion]236-our companion maintained [his]105-holmes impenetrable reserve until the end of [our]235-we journey .

It was a September evening , and not yet seven o clock , but the day had been a dreary one , and a dense drizzly fog lay low upon [the great city]237-the great city . Mud - coloured clouds drooped sadly over [the muddy streets]238-the muddy streets . Down the Strand the lamps were but misty splotches of diffused light which threw a feeble circular glimmer upon the slimy pavement . The yellow glare from [the shop]239-the shop - windows streamed out into the steamy , vaporous air , and threw a murky , shifting radiance across [the crowded thoroughfare]240-the crowded thoroughfare . There was , to [my]0-i mind , something eerie and ghost - like in the endless procession of faces which flitted across these narrow bars of light , sad faces and glad , haggard and merry . Like [all human kind]241-all human kind , [they]242-they flitted from the gloom into the light , and so back into the gloom once more . [I]0-i am not subject to impressions , but the dull , heavy evening , with the strange business upon which [we]235-we were engaged , combined to make [me]0-i nervous and depressed . [I]0-i could see from [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan s manner that [she]112-miss morstan was suffering from the same feeling . [Holmes]105-holmes alone could rise superior to petty influences . [He]236-our companion held [his]236-our companion open note - book upon [his]236-our companion knee , and from time to time [he]236-our companion jotted down figures and memoranda in the light of [his]236-our companion pocket - lantern .

At [the Lyceum Theatre]811-the lyceum theatre [the crowds]244-the crowds were already thick at the side - entrances . In front a continuous stream of hansoms and [four - wheelers]245-four - wheelers were rattling up , discharging [their]242-they cargoes of shirt - fronted men and [beshawled , bediamonded women]246-beshawled , bediamonded women . [We]235-we had hardly reached the third pillar , which was [[our]235-we rendezvous]247-our rendezvous , before [a small , dark , brisk man in the dress of a coachman]248-a small , dark , brisk man in the dress of a coachman accosted [us]235-we .

" Are [you]249-you the parties who come with [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan ? "[236-our companion] [he]236-our companion asked .

" [I]249-you am [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan , and [these two gentlemen]862-these two gentlemen are [[my]249-you friends]863-my friends , "[249-you] said [she]249-you .

[He]236-our companion bent a pair of wonderfully penetrating and questioning eyes upon [us]235-we . " [You]249-you will excuse [me]236-our companion , [miss]864-miss , "[236-our companion] [he]236-our companion said with a certain dogged manner , " but [I]236-our companion was to ask [you]864-miss to give [me]236-our companion [your]864-miss word that [neither of [[your]864-miss companions]866-your companions]865-neither of your companions is [a police - officer]867-a police - officer . "[236-our companion]

" [I]249-you give [you]236-our companion [my]249-you word on that , "[249-you] [she]249-you answered .

[He]236-our companion gave a shrill whistle , on which a street Arab led across [a four - wheeler]846-a four - wheeler and opened the door . [The man who had addressed [us]235-we]251-the man who had addressed us mounted to the box , while [we]235-we took [our]235-we places inside . [We]235-we had hardly done so before [the driver]252-the driver whipped up [his]252-the driver horse , and [we]235-we plunged away at a furious pace through [the foggy streets]253-the foggy streets .

The situation was a curious one . [We]235-we were driving to [an unknown place]254-an unknown place , on an unknown errand . Yet [our]235-we invitation was either a complete hoax , which was an inconceivable hypothesis , or else [we]235-we had good reason to think that important issues might hang upon [our]235-we journey . [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan s demeanor was as resolute and collected as ever . [I]0-i endeavored to cheer and amuse [her]112-miss morstan by reminiscences of [my]0-i adventures in [Afghanistan]12-afghanistan ; but , to tell the truth , [I]0-i was [myself]0-i so excited at [our]235-we situation and so curious as to [our]235-we destination that [my]0-i stories were slightly involved . To this day [she]112-miss morstan declares that [I]0-i told [her]112-miss morstan one moving anecdote as to how a musket looked into [[my]0-i tent]255-my tent at the dead of night , and how [I]0-i fired a double - barrelled tiger cub at it . At first [I]0-i had some idea as to the direction in which [we]235-we were driving ; but soon , what with [our]235-we pace , the fog , and [my]0-i own limited knowledge of [London]8-london , [I]0-i lost [my]0-i bearings , and knew nothing , save that [we]235-we seemed to be going a very long way . [Sherlock Holmes]105-holmes was never at fault , however , and [he]105-holmes muttered the names as [the cab]234-the cab rattled through [squares]257-squares and in and out by [tortuous by - streets]258-tortuous by - streets .

" [Rochester Row]13-rochester row , "[105-holmes] said [he]105-holmes . " Now [Vincent Square]14-vincent square . Now [we]235-we come out on [the Vauxhall Bridge Road]15-the vauxhall bridge road . [We]235-we are making for the [Surrey]16-surrey side , apparently . Yes , [I]105-holmes thought so . Now [we]235-we are on the bridge . [You]868-you can catch glimpses of [the river]869-the river . "[105-holmes]

[We]235-we did indeed get a fleeting view of [a stretch of [the Thames]17-the thames]259-a stretch of the thames with the lamps shining upon [the broad , silent water]260-the broad , silent water ; but [[our]235-we cab]261-our cab dashed on , and was soon involved in a labyrinth of streets upon the other side .

" [Wordsworth Road]18-wordsworth road , "[195-my companion] said [[my]0-i companion]195-my companion . " [Priory Road]19-priory road . [Lark Hall Lane]20-lark hall lane . [We]235-we had , indeed , reached [a questionable and forbidding neighbourhood]263-a questionable and forbidding neighbourhood . [Long lines of dull brick houses]264-long lines of dull brick houses were only relieved by the coarse glare and tawdry brilliancy of [public houses]265-public houses at the corner . On [our]235-we knocking , however , the door was instantly thrown open by [a Hindoo servant]275-a hindoo servant clad in a yellow turban , white loose - fitting clothes , and a yellow sash . There was something strangely incongruous in this Oriental figure framed in the commonplace doorway of [a third - rate suburban dwelling - house]276-a third - rate suburban dwelling - house .

Chapter IV The Story of [the Bald - Headed Man]278-the bald - headed man

[We]235-we followed [the Indian]279-the indian down [a sordid and common passage]280-a sordid and common passage , ill - lit and worse furnished , until [he]279-the indian came to a door upon the right , which [he]279-the indian threw open . A blaze of yellow light streamed out upon [us]235-we , and in the centre of the glare there stood [a small man with a very high head , a bristle of red hair all round the fringe of it , and a bald , shining scalp which shot out from among it like a mountain - peak from fir - trees]281-a small man with a very high head , a bristle of red hair all round the fringe of it , and a bald , shining scalp which shot out from among it like a mountain - peak from fir - trees . [He]279-the indian writhed [his]279-the indian hands together as [he]279-the indian stood , and [his]279-the indian features were in a perpetual jerk , now smiling , now scowling , but never for an instant in repose . [Nature]123-nature had given [him]279-the indian a pendulous lip , and a too visible line of yellow and irregular teeth , which [he]279-the indian strove feebly to conceal by constantly passing [his]279-the indian hand over the lower part of [his]279-the indian face . In spite of [his]279-the indian obtrusive baldness , [he]279-the indian gave the impression of youth . In point of fact [he]279-the indian had just turned [his]279-the indian thirtieth year .

" [[Your]873-your servant]874-your servant , [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan , "[279-the indian] [he]279-the indian kept repeating , in a thin , high voice . " [[Your]873-your servant]874-your servant , [gentlemen]876-gentlemen . Pray step into [[my]279-the indian little sanctum]877-my little sanctum . [A small place , [miss]864-miss , but furnished to [my]279-the indian own liking]878-a small place , miss , but furnished to my own liking . [An oasis of art in [the howling desert of South [London]8-london]881-the howling desert of south london]880-an oasis of art in the howling desert of south london . "[279-the indian]

[We]282-we were all astonished by the appearance of [the apartment into which [he]279-the indian invited [us]282-we]283-the apartment into which he invited us . In [that sorry house]284-that sorry house [it]284-that sorry house looked as out of place as a diamond of the first water in a setting of brass . The richest and glossiest of curtains and tapestries draped the walls , looped back here and there to expose some richly - mounted painting or Oriental vase . The carpet was of amber - and - black , so soft and so thick that the foot sank pleasantly into it , as into a bed of moss . Two great tiger - skins thrown athwart it increased the suggestion of Eastern luxury , as did a huge hookah which stood upon a mat in the corner . A lamp in the fashion of a silver dove was hung from an almost invisible golden wire in the centre of [the room]206-the room . As it burned it filled the air with a subtle and aromatic odour .

" [Mr. Thaddeus Sholto]124-thaddeus sholto , "[286-the little man] said [the little man]286-the little man , still jerking and smiling . " That is [my]286-the little man name . [You]864-miss are [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan , of course . And [these gentlemen]882-these gentlemen "[286-the little man]

" This is [Mr. Sherlock Holmes]105-holmes , and this is [Dr. Watson]106-watson . "[279-the indian]

" [A doctor]883-a doctor , eh ? "[279-the indian] cried [he]279-the indian , much excited . " Have [you]864-miss [your]864-miss stethoscope ? Might [I]279-the indian ask [you]864-miss would [you]864-miss have the kindness ? [I]279-the indian have grave doubts as to [my]279-the indian mitral valve , if [you]864-miss would be so very good . The aortic [I]279-the indian may rely upon , but [I]279-the indian should value [your]864-miss opinion upon the mitral . "[279-the indian]

[I]0-i listened to [his]279-the indian heart , as requested , but was unable to find anything amiss , save indeed that [he]279-the indian was in an ecstasy of fear , for [he]279-the indian shivered from head to foot . " It appears to be normal , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [You]279-the indian have no cause for uneasiness . "[0-i]

" [You]864-miss will excuse [my]279-the indian anxiety , [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan , "[279-the indian] [he]279-the indian remarked , airily . " [I]279-the indian am [a great sufferer]884-a great sufferer , and [I]279-the indian have long had suspicions as to that valve . [I]279-the indian am delighted to hear that [they]885-they are unwarranted . Had [[your]112-miss morstan father]740-your father , [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan , refrained from throwing a strain upon [his]740-your father heart , [he]740-your father might have been alive now . "[279-the indian]

[I]0-i could have struck [the man]287-the man across the face , so hot was [I]0-i at this callous and off - hand reference to so delicate a matter . [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan sat down , and [her]112-miss morstan face grew white to the lips . " [I]112-miss morstan knew in [my]112-miss morstan heart that [he]740-your father was dead , "[112-miss morstan] said [she]112-miss morstan .

" [I]287-the man can give [you]112-miss morstan every information , "[287-the man] said [he]287-the man , " and , what is more , [I]287-the man can do [you]112-miss morstan justice ; and [I]287-the man will , too , whatever [Brother Bartholomew]125-brother bartholomew may say . [I]287-the man am so glad to have [[your]112-miss morstan friends]887-your friends here , not only as an escort to [you]112-miss morstan , but also as witnesses to what [I]287-the man am about to do and say . [The three of [us]888-the three of us]888-the three of us can show a bold front to [Brother Bartholomew]125-brother bartholomew . But let [us]888-the three of us have [no outsiders]889-no outsiders , [no police]890-no police or [officials]891-officials . [We]888-the three of us can settle everything satisfactorily among [ourselves]888-the three of us , without any interference . Nothing would annoy [Brother Bartholomew]125-brother bartholomew more than any publicity . "[287-the man] [He]287-the man sat down upon a low settee and blinked at [us]288-us inquiringly with [his]287-the man weak , watery blue eyes .

" For [my]105-holmes part , "[105-holmes] said [Holmes]105-holmes , " whatever [you]112-miss morstan may choose to say will go no further . "[105-holmes]

[I]0-i nodded to show [my]0-i agreement .

" That is well ! That is well ! "[287-the man] said [he]287-the man . " May [I]287-the man offer [you]0-i a glass of [Chianti]126-chianti , [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan ? Or of [Tokay]127-tokay ? Well , then , [I]287-the man trust that [you]0-i have no objection to tobacco - smoke , to the mild balsamic odour of the Eastern tobacco . [I]287-the man am a little nervous , and [I]287-the man find [my]287-the man hookah an invaluable sedative . "[287-the man] [He]287-the man applied a taper to the great bowl , and the smoke bubbled merrily through the rose - water . [We]289-our sat all three in a semi - circle , with [our]289-our heads advanced , and [our]289-our chins upon [our]289-our hands , while [the strange , jerky little fellow , with [his]290-the strange , jerky little fellow , with his high , shining head high , shining head]290-the strange , jerky little fellow , with his high , shining head , puffed uneasily in the centre .

" When [I]287-the man first determined to make this communication to [you]0-i , "[287-the man] said [he]287-the man , " [I]287-the man might have given [you]0-i [my]287-the man address , but [I]287-the man feared that [you]0-i might disregard [my]287-the man request and bring [unpleasant people]892-unpleasant people with [you]0-i . [You]0-i will excuse these precautions , but [I]287-the man am [a man of somewhat retiring]894-a man of somewhat retiring , and [I]287-the man might even say refined , tastes , and there is nothing more un sthetic than [a policeman]895-a policeman . [I]287-the man am partial to the modern French school . "[287-the man]

" [You]291-i will excuse [me]112-miss morstan , [Mr. Sholto]124-thaddeus sholto , "[112-miss morstan] said [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan , " but [I]112-miss morstan am here at [your]291-i request to learn something which [you]291-i desire to tell [me]112-miss morstan . " At the best it must take some time , "[291-i] [he]291-i answered ; " for [we]900-we shall certainly have to go to [Norwood]24-norwood and see [Brother Bartholomew]125-brother bartholomew . [We]900-we shall all go and try if [we]900-we can get the better of [Brother Bartholomew]125-brother bartholomew . [He]125-brother bartholomew is very angry with [me]291-i for taking the course which has seemed right to [me]291-i . [I]291-i had quite high words with [him]125-brother bartholomew last night . [You]0-i can not imagine what [a terrible fellow]901-a terrible fellow [he]125-brother bartholomew is when [he]125-brother bartholomew is angry . "[291-i]

" If [we]900-we are to go to [Norwood]24-norwood it would perhaps be as well to start at once , "[0-i] [I]0-i ventured to remark .

[He]291-i laughed until [his]291-i ears were quite red . " That would hardly do , "[291-i] [he]291-i cried . " [I]291-i don t know what [he]125-brother bartholomew would say if [I]291-i brought [you]0-i in that sudden way . No , [I]291-i must prepare [you]0-i by showing [you]0-i how [we]900-we all stand to [each other]902-each other . [I]291-i can only lay the facts before [you]0-i as far as [I]291-i know them [myself]291-i .[291-i]

" [[My]291-i father]770-my father was , as [you]0-i may have guessed , [Major John Sholto]116-major sholto , once of [the Indian army]904-the indian army . [He]770-my father retired some eleven years ago , and came to live at [Pondicherry Lodge]25-pondicherry lodge in [Upper Norwood]11-upper norwood . [He]770-my father had prospered in [India]26-india , and brought back with [him]770-my father a considerable sum of money , a large collection of valuable curiosities , and a staff of [native servants]905-native servants . With these advantages [he]770-my father bought [himself]770-my father [a house]906-a house , and lived in great luxury . [[My]291-i twin - brother]907-my twin - brother [Bartholomew]125-brother bartholomew and [I]291-i were [the only children]908-the only children .[291-i]

" [I]291-i very well remember the sensation which was caused by the disappearance of [Captain Morstan]115-captain morstan . [We]909-we read the details in the papers , and , knowing that [he]770-my father had been [a friend of [[our]909-we father]911-our father s]910-a friend of our father s , [we]909-we discussed the case freely in [his]770-my father presence . [He]770-my father used to join in [our]909-we speculations as to what could have happened . Never for an instant did [we]909-we suspect that [he]770-my father had the whole secret hidden in [his]770-my father own breast , that of all [men]912-men [he]770-my father alone knew the fate of [Arthur Morstan]131-morstan .[291-i]

" [We]909-we did know , however , that some mystery some positive danger overhung [[our]909-we father]911-our father . [He]770-my father was very fearful of going out alone , and [he]770-my father always employed [two prize - fighters]914-two prize - fighters to act as [[porters]915-porters at [Pondicherry Lodge]25-pondicherry lodge]916-porters at pondicherry lodge . [Williams]128-williams , who drove [you]917-you to - night , was [one of [them]914-two prize - fighters]918-one of them . [He]128-williams was once [light - weight champion of [England]6-england]919-light - weight champion of england . [[Our]909-we father]911-our father would never tell [us]909-we what it was [he]770-my father feared , but [he]770-my father had a most marked aversion to [men with wooden legs]921-men with wooden legs . On one occasion [he]770-my father actually fired [his]770-my father revolver at [a wooden - legged man]922-a wooden - legged man , who proved to be [a harmless tradesman canvassing for orders]923-a harmless tradesman canvassing for orders . [We]909-we had to pay a large sum to hush the matter up . [[My]291-i brother]924-my brother and [I]291-i used to think this a mere whim of [[my]291-i father]770-my father s , but events have since led [us]909-we to change [our]909-we opinion .[291-i]

" Early in 1882 [[my]291-i father]770-my father received a letter from [India]26-india which was a great shock to [him]770-my father . [He]770-my father nearly fainted at the breakfast - table when [he]770-my father opened it , and from that day [he]770-my father sickened to [his]770-my father death . What was in the letter [we]909-we could never discover , but [I]291-i could see as [he]770-my father held it that it was short and written in a scrawling hand . [He]770-my father had suffered for years from an enlarged spleen , but [he]770-my father now became rapidly worse , and towards the end of April [we]909-we were informed that [he]770-my father was beyond all hope , and that [he]770-my father wished to make a last communication to [us]909-we .[291-i]

" When [we]909-we entered [[his]770-my father room]927-his room [he]770-my father was propped up with pillows and breathing heavily . [He]770-my father besought [us]909-we to lock the door and to come upon either side of the bed . Then , grasping [our]909-we hands , [he]770-my father made a remarkable statement to [us]909-we , in a voice which was broken as much by emotion as by pain . [I]291-i shall try and give it to [you]909-we in [his]770-my father own very words .[291-i]

" [I]291-i have only one thing , [he]770-my father said , which weighs upon [my]291-i mind at this supreme moment . It is [my]291-i treatment of [poor [Morstan]131-morstan s orphan]928-poor morstan s orphan . The cursed greed which has been [my]291-i besetting sin through life has withheld from [her]928-poor morstan s orphan the treasure , half at least of which should have been [hers]928-poor morstan s orphan . And yet [I]291-i have made no use of it [myself]291-i , so blind and foolish a thing is avarice . The mere feeling of possession has been so dear to [me]291-i that [I]291-i could not bear to share it with [another]703-another . See that chaplet dipped with pearls beside the quinine - bottle . Even that [I]291-i could not bear to part with , although [I]291-i had got it out with the design of sending it to [her]928-poor morstan s orphan . [You]909-we , [[my]291-i sons]930-my sons , will give [her]928-poor morstan s orphan a fair share of the Agra treasure . But send [her]928-poor morstan s orphan nothing not even the chaplet until [I]291-i am gone . After all , [men]912-men have been as bad as this and have recovered .[291-i]

" [I]291-i will tell [you]909-we how [Morstan]131-morstan died , [he]131-morstan continued . [He]131-morstan had suffered for years from a weak heart , but [he]131-morstan concealed it from every one . [I]291-i alone knew it . When in [India]26-india , [he]131-morstan and [I]291-i , through a remarkable chain of circumstances , came into possession of a considerable treasure . [I]291-i brought it over to [England]6-england , and on the night of [Morstan]131-morstan s arrival [he]131-morstan came straight over here to claim [his]131-morstan share . [He]131-morstan walked over from [the station]932-the station , and was admitted by [[my]291-i faithful old [Lal Chowdar]133-lal chowdar , who is now dead]133-lal chowdar . [Morstan]933-morstan and [I]291-i had a difference of opinion as to the division of the treasure , and [we]934-we came to heated words . [Morstan]131-morstan had sprung out of [his]131-morstan chair in a paroxysm of anger , when [he]131-morstan suddenly pressed [his]131-morstan hand to [his]131-morstan side , [his]131-morstan face turned a dusky hue , and [he]131-morstan fell backwards , cutting [his]131-morstan head against the corner of the treasure - chest . When [I]291-i stooped over [him]131-morstan [I]291-i found , to [my]291-i horror , that [he]131-morstan was dead .[291-i]

" For a long time [I]293-i sat half distracted , wondering what [I]293-i should do . [My]293-i first impulse was , of course , to call for assistance ; but [I]293-i could not but recognise that there was every chance that [I]293-i would be accused of [his]131-morstan murder . [His]131-morstan death at the moment of a quarrel , and the gash in [his]131-morstan head , would be black against [me]293-i . Again , an official inquiry could not be made without bringing out some facts about the treasure , which [I]293-i was particularly anxious to keep secret . [He]131-morstan had told [me]293-i that [no soul upon earth]935-no soul upon earth knew where [he]131-morstan had gone . There seemed to be no necessity why [any soul]936-any soul ever should know .[293-i]

" [I]293-i was still pondering over the matter , when , looking up , [I]293-i saw [[my]293-i servant]937-my servant , [Lal Chowdar]133-lal chowdar , in the doorway . [He]133-lal chowdar stole in and bolted the door behind [him]133-lal chowdar . "[293-i] Do not fear , [Sahib]122-sahib , " [he]133-lal chowdar said . "[293-i] [No one]730-no one need know that [you]122-sahib have killed [him]293-i . Let [us]294-my hide [him]293-i away , and who is the wiser ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i did not kill [him]293-i , " said I. [Lal Chowdar]133-lal chowdar shook [his]133-lal chowdar head and smiled . "[0-i] [I]0-i heard it all , [Sahib]122-sahib , " said [he]133-lal chowdar . "[0-i] [I]0-i heard [you]122-sahib quarrel , and [I]0-i heard the blow . But [my]0-i lips are sealed . [All]295-all are asleep in [the house]296-the house . Let [us]294-my put [him]293-i away together . " That was enough to decide [me]294-my . If [[my]294-my own servant]938-my own servant could not believe [my]294-my innocence , how could [I]294-my hope to make it good before [twelve foolish tradesmen in a jury - box]939-twelve foolish tradesmen in a jury - box ? [Lal Chowdar]133-lal chowdar and [I]294-my disposed of the body that night , and within a few days the [London]8-london papers were full of the mysterious disappearance of [Captain Morstan]115-captain morstan . [You]122-sahib will see from what [I]294-my say that [I]294-my can hardly be blamed in the matter . [My]294-my fault lies in the fact that [we]294-my concealed not only the body , but also the treasure , and that [I]294-my have clung to [Morstan]115-captain morstan s share as well as to [my]294-my own . [I]294-my wish [you]122-sahib , therefore , to make restitution . Put [your]122-sahib ears down to [my]294-my mouth . The treasure is hidden in[294-my]

" At this instant a horrible change came over [his]133-lal chowdar expression ; [his]133-lal chowdar eyes stared wildly , [his]133-lal chowdar jaw dropped , and [he]133-lal chowdar yelled , in a voice which [I]0-i can never forget , Keep [him]133-lal chowdar out ! For Christ s sake keep [him]133-lal chowdar out ! [We]294-my both stared round at the window behind [us]294-my upon which [his]133-lal chowdar gaze was fixed . A face was looking in at [us]294-my out of the darkness . [We]294-my could see the whitening of the nose where it was pressed against the glass . It was [a bearded , hairy face , with wild cruel eyes and an expression of concentrated malevolence]940-a bearded , hairy face , with wild cruel eyes and an expression of concentrated malevolence . [[My]0-i brother]924-my brother and [I]0-i rushed towards the window , but [the man]287-the man was gone . When [we]294-my returned to [[my]0-i father]770-my father [his]133-lal chowdar head had dropped and [his]133-lal chowdar pulse had ceased to beat . "[0-i]

" [We]294-my searched [the garden]944-the garden that night , but found no sign of [the intruder]945-the intruder , save that just under the window a single footmark was visible in the flower - bed . But for that one trace , [we]294-my might have thought that [our]294-my imaginations had conjured up that wild , fierce face . [We]294-my soon , however , had another and a more striking proof that there were secret agencies at work all round [us]294-my . The window of [[[my]294-my father]770-my father s room]947-my father s room was found open in the morning , [his]133-lal chowdar cupboards and boxes had been rifled , and upon [his]133-lal chowdar chest was fixed a torn piece of paper , with the words The sign of the four scrawled across it . What the phrase meant , or who [[our]294-my secret visitor]948-our secret visitor may have been , [we]294-my never knew . As far as [we]294-my can judge , none of [[my]294-my father]770-my father s property had been actually stolen , though everything had been turned out . [[My]294-my brother]924-my brother and [I]294-my naturally associated this peculiar incident with the fear which haunted [[my]294-my father]770-my father during [his]770-my father life ; but it is still a complete mystery to [us]294-my . "[294-my]

[The little man]286-the little man stopped to relight [his]286-the little man hookah and puffed thoughtfully for a few moments . [We]298-we had all sat absorbed , listening to [his]286-the little man extraordinary narrative . At the short account of [[her]299-her father]842-her father s death [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan had turned deadly white , and for a moment [I]0-i feared that [she]299-her was about to faint . [She]299-her rallied however , on drinking a glass of water which [I]0-i quietly poured out for [her]299-her from a Venetian carafe upon the side - table . [Sherlock Holmes]105-holmes leaned back in [his]105-holmes chair with an abstracted expression and the lids drawn low over [his]105-holmes glittering eyes . As [I]0-i glanced at [him]105-holmes [I]0-i could not but think how on that very day [he]105-holmes had complained bitterly of the commonplaceness of life . Here at least was a problem which would tax [his]105-holmes sagacity to the utmost . [Mr. Thaddeus Sholto]124-thaddeus sholto looked from one to the other of [us]298-we with an obvious pride at the effect which [his]105-holmes story had produced , and then continued between the puffs of [his]105-holmes overgrown pipe .

" [[My]105-holmes brother]924-my brother and [I]105-holmes , "[105-holmes] said [he]105-holmes , " were , as [you]0-i may imagine , much excited as to the treasure which [[my]105-holmes father]770-my father had spoken of . For weeks and for months [we]298-we dug and delved in every part of [the garden]944-the garden , without discovering its whereabouts . It was maddening to think that the hiding - place was on [his]105-holmes very lips at the moment that [he]105-holmes died . [We]298-we could judge the splendour of the missing riches by the chaplet which [he]105-holmes had taken out . Over this chaplet [[my]105-holmes brother]924-my brother [Bartholomew]125-brother bartholomew and [I]105-holmes had some little discussion . The pearls were evidently of great value , and [he]105-holmes was averse to part with them , for , between [friends]956-friends , [[my]105-holmes brother]924-my brother was [himself]105-holmes a little inclined to [[my]105-holmes father]770-my father s fault . [He]105-holmes thought , too , that if [we]298-we parted with [the chaplet]959-the chaplet it might give rise to gossip and finally bring [us]298-we into trouble . It was all that [I]105-holmes could do to persuade [him]105-holmes to let [me]105-holmes find out [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan s address and send [her]112-miss morstan a detached pearl at fixed intervals , so that at least [she]112-miss morstan might never feel destitute . "[105-holmes]

" It was a kindly thought , "[236-our companion] said [[our]301-our companion]236-our companion , earnestly . " It was extremely good of [you]286-the little man . "[236-our companion]

[We]298-we had plenty of money [ourselves]298-we . [I]286-the little man desired no more . [Mr. Thaddeus Sholto]124-thaddeus sholto ceased , and sat twitching on [his]124-thaddeus sholto luxurious settee . [[Our]304-our new acquaintance]305-our new acquaintance very deliberately coiled up the tube of [his]305-our new acquaintance hookah , and produced from behind a curtain a very long befrogged topcoat with Astrakhan collar and cuffs . This [he]305-our new acquaintance buttoned tightly up , in spite of the extreme closeness of the night , and finished [his]305-our new acquaintance attire by putting on a rabbit - skin cap with hanging lappets which covered the ears , so that no part of [him]305-our new acquaintance was visible save [his]305-our new acquaintance mobile and peaky face . " [I]305-our new acquaintance am compelled to be [a valetudinarian]964-a valetudinarian . "[305-our new acquaintance]

[[Our]304-our cab]261-our cab was awaiting [us]304-our outside , and [our]304-our programme was evidently prearranged , for [the driver]252-the driver started off at once at a rapid pace . [Thaddeus Sholto]124-thaddeus sholto talked incessantly , in a voice which rose high above the rattle of the wheels .

" [Bartholomew]125-brother bartholomew is [a clever fellow]965-a clever fellow , "[124-thaddeus sholto] said [he]124-thaddeus sholto . " How do [you]966-you think [he]125-brother bartholomew found out where the treasure was ? [He]125-brother bartholomew had come to the conclusion that it was somewhere indoors : so [he]125-brother bartholomew worked out all the cubic space of [the house]296-the house , and made measurements everywhere , so that not one inch should be unaccounted for . Among other things , [he]125-brother bartholomew found that the height of [the building]968-the building was seventy - four feet , but on adding together the heights of all [the separate rooms]969-the separate rooms , and making every allowance for the space between , which [he]125-brother bartholomew ascertained by borings , [he]125-brother bartholomew could not bring the total to more than seventy feet . There were four feet unaccounted for . These could only be at the top of [the building]968-the building . [He]125-brother bartholomew knocked a hole , therefore , in the lath - and - plaster ceiling of [the highest room]971-the highest room , and there , sure enough , [he]125-brother bartholomew came upon another little garret above [it]968-the building , which had been sealed up and was known to [no one]730-no one . In the centre stood the treasure - chest , resting upon two rafters . [He]125-brother bartholomew lowered it through the hole , and there it lies . [He]125-brother bartholomew computes the value of the jewels at not less than half a million sterling . "[124-thaddeus sholto]

At the mention of this gigantic sum [we]309-our all stared at [one another]310-one another open - eyed . [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan , could [we]309-our secure [her]112-miss morstan rights , would change from [a needy governess]311-a needy governess to [the richest heiress in [England]6-england]312-the richest heiress in england . Surely it was the place of [a loyal friend]313-a loyal friend to rejoice at such news ; yet [I]0-i am ashamed to say that selfishness took [me]0-i by the soul , and that [my]0-i heart turned as heavy as lead within [me]0-i . [I]0-i stammered out some few halting words of congratulation , and then sat downcast , with [my]0-i head drooped , deaf to the babble of [[our]309-our new acquaintance]305-our new acquaintance . [He]305-our new acquaintance was clearly a confirmed hypochondriac , and [I]0-i was dreamily conscious that [he]305-our new acquaintance was pouring forth interminable trains of symptoms , and imploring information as to the composition and action of innumerable quack nostrums , some of which [he]305-our new acquaintance bore about in a leather case in [his]305-our new acquaintance pocket . [I]0-i trust that [he]305-our new acquaintance may not remember any of the answers which [I]0-i gave [him]305-our new acquaintance that night . [Holmes]105-holmes declares that [he]305-our new acquaintance overheard [me]0-i caution [him]305-our new acquaintance against the great danger of taking more than two drops of castor oil , while [I]0-i recommended strychnine in large doses as a sedative . However that may be , [I]0-i was certainly relieved when [[our]309-our cab]261-our cab pulled up with a jerk and [the coachman]316-the coachman sprang down to open the door .

" This , [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan , is [Pondicherry Lodge]25-pondicherry lodge , "[124-thaddeus sholto] said [Mr. Thaddeus Sholto]124-thaddeus sholto , as [he]124-thaddeus sholto handed [her]317-her out .

Chapter V The Tragedy of [Pondicherry Lodge]25-pondicherry lodge

It was nearly eleven o clock when [we]309-our reached this final stage of [our]309-our night s adventures . [We]309-our had left the damp fog of [the great city]237-the great city behind [us]309-our , and the night was fairly fine . A warm wind blew from [the westward]319-the westward , and heavy clouds moved slowly across the sky , with half a moon peeping occasionally through the rifts . It was clear enough to see for some distance , but [Thaddeus Sholto]124-thaddeus sholto took down one of the side - lamps from [the carriage]320-the carriage to give [us]309-our a better light upon [our]309-our way .

[Pondicherry Lodge]25-pondicherry lodge stood in [[its]25-pondicherry lodge own grounds]321-its own grounds , and was girt round with a very high stone wall topped with broken glass . A single narrow iron - clamped door formed the only means of entrance . On this [[our]309-our guide]322-our guide knocked with a peculiar postman - like rat - tat .

" Who is there ? "[323-a gruff voice from within] cried [a gruff voice from within]323-a gruff voice from within .

" It is [I]323-a gruff voice from within , [McMurdo]135-mcmurdo . [You]135-mcmurdo surely know [my]323-a gruff voice from within knock by this time . "[323-a gruff voice from within]

There was a grumbling sound and a clanking and jarring of keys . The door swung heavily back , and [a short , deep - chested man]324-a short , deep - chested man stood in the opening , with the yellow light of the lantern shining upon [his]324-a short , deep - chested man protruded face and twinkling distrustful eyes .

" That [you]324-a short , deep - chested man , [Mr. Thaddeus]124-thaddeus sholto ? But who are [the others]973-the others ? [I]324-a short , deep - chested man had no orders about [them]973-the others from [the master]974-the master . "[324-a short , deep - chested man]

" No , [McMurdo]135-mcmurdo ? [You]135-mcmurdo surprise [me]324-a short , deep - chested man ! [I]324-a short , deep - chested man told [[my]324-a short , deep - chested man brother]924-my brother last night that [I]324-a short , deep - chested man should bring [some friends]976-some friends . "[324-a short , deep - chested man]

" [He]924-my brother ain t been out o [[his]924-my brother room]927-his room to - day , [Mr. Thaddeus]124-thaddeus sholto , and [I]324-a short , deep - chested man have no orders . [You]124-thaddeus sholto know very well that [I]324-a short , deep - chested man must stick to regulations . [I]324-a short , deep - chested man can let [you]124-thaddeus sholto in , but [[your]124-thaddeus sholto friends]887-your friends must just stop where [they]887-your friends are . "[324-a short , deep - chested man]

This was an unexpected obstacle . [Thaddeus Sholto]124-thaddeus sholto looked about [him]124-thaddeus sholto in a perplexed and helpless manner . " In [you]124-thaddeus sholto come , [sir]765-sir , in [you]124-thaddeus sholto come , [you]124-thaddeus sholto and [[your]124-thaddeus sholto friends]887-your friends , "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes answered . Inside , [a gravel path]327-a gravel path wound through [desolate grounds]328-desolate grounds to a huge clump of [a house]906-a house , square and prosaic , all plunged in shadow save where a moonbeam struck one corner and glimmered in a garret window . Even [Thaddeus Sholto]124-thaddeus sholto seemed ill at ease , and the lantern quivered and rattled in [his]124-thaddeus sholto hand .

" [I]124-thaddeus sholto can not understand it , "[124-thaddeus sholto] [he]124-thaddeus sholto said . " There must be some mistake . "[124-thaddeus sholto]

" Ah , that is [[the housekeeper]1001-the housekeeper s room]1002-the housekeeper s room . That is where [old Mrs. Bernstone]137-mrs. bernstone sits . [He]105-holmes held up the lantern , and [his]105-holmes hand shook until the circles of light flickered and wavered all round [us]331-we . [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan seized [my]0-i wrist , and [we]331-we all stood with thumping hearts , straining [our]331-we ears . " It is [Mrs. Bernstone]137-mrs. bernstone , "[124-thaddeus sholto] said [Sholto]124-thaddeus sholto . " [She]137-mrs. bernstone is [the only woman in [the house]296-the house]1005-the only woman in the house . Wait [here]996-here . [I]124-thaddeus sholto shall be back in a moment . "[124-thaddeus sholto] [He]105-holmes hurried for the door , and knocked in [his]105-holmes peculiar way . [We]331-we could see [a tall old woman]334-a tall old woman admit [him]105-holmes , and sway with pleasure at the very sight of [him]105-holmes .

" Oh , [Mr. Thaddeus]124-thaddeus sholto , [sir]765-sir , [I]334-a tall old woman am so glad [you]765-sir have come ! [I]334-a tall old woman am so glad [you]765-sir have come , [Mr. Thaddeus]124-thaddeus sholto , [sir]765-sir ! "[334-a tall old woman] [We]331-we heard [her]334-a tall old woman reiterated rejoicings until the door was closed and [her]334-a tall old woman voice died away into a muffled monotone .

[[Our]331-we guide]322-our guide had left [us]331-we the lantern . [Holmes]105-holmes swung it slowly round , and peered keenly at [the house]296-the house , and at the great rubbish - heaps which cumbered [the grounds]337-the grounds . [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan and [I]0-i stood together , and [her]334-a tall old woman hand was in [mine]0-i . A wondrous subtle thing is love , for here were [we]331-we two who had never seen [each other]902-each other before that day , between [whom no word or even look of affection had ever passed]339-whom no word or even look of affection had ever passed , and yet now in an hour of trouble [our]331-we hands instinctively sought for [each other]902-each other . [I]0-i have marvelled at it since , but at the time it seemed the most natural thing that [I]0-i should go out to [her]334-a tall old woman so , and , as [she]334-a tall old woman has often told [me]0-i , there was in [her]334-a tall old woman also the instinct to turn to [me]0-i for comfort and protection . So [we]331-we stood hand in hand , like [two children]341-two children , and there was peace in [our]331-we hearts for all the dark things that surrounded [us]331-we .

" What a strange place ! "[334-a tall old woman] [she]334-a tall old woman said , looking round .

" It looks as though all the moles in [England]6-england had been let loose in [it]6-england . [I]334-a tall old woman have seen something of the sort on the side of [a hill near [Ballarat]28-ballarat , where [the prospectors]1011-the prospectors had been at work]1010-a hill near ballarat , where the prospectors had been at work . "[334-a tall old woman]

" And from the same cause , "[105-holmes] said [Holmes]105-holmes . " These are the traces of [the treasure - seekers]1012-the treasure - seekers . [You]1013-you must remember that [they]1012-the treasure - seekers were six years looking for it . No wonder that [the grounds]337-the grounds look like [a gravel - pit]1015-a gravel - pit . "[105-holmes]

At that moment the door of [the house]296-the house burst open , and [Thaddeus Sholto]124-thaddeus sholto came running out , with [his]124-thaddeus sholto hands thrown forward and terror in [his]124-thaddeus sholto eyes .

" Come into [the house]296-the house , "[105-holmes] said [Holmes]105-holmes , in [his]105-holmes crisp , firm way .

[We]344-we all followed [him]124-thaddeus sholto into [[the housekeeper]1001-the housekeeper s room , which stood upon the left - hand side of [the passage]306-the passage]346-the housekeeper s room , which stood upon the left - hand side of the passage . [The old woman]348-the old woman was pacing up and down with a scared look and restless picking fingers , but the sight of [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan appeared to have a soothing effect upon [her]348-the old woman .

[[Our]344-we companion]236-our companion patted [her]348-the old woman thin , work - worn hand , and murmured some few words of kindly womanly comfort which brought the colour back into the other s bloodless cheeks .

" [Master]1017-master has locked [himself]1017-master in and will not answer [me]348-the old woman , "[348-the old woman] [she]348-the old woman explained . " All day [I]348-the old woman have waited to hear from [him]1017-master , for [he]1017-master often likes to be alone ; but an hour ago [I]348-the old woman feared that something was amiss , so [I]348-the old woman went up and peeped through the key - hole .
