"[348-the old woman]

[Sherlock Holmes]105-holmes took the lamp and led the way , for [Thaddeus Sholto]124-thaddeus sholto s teeth were chattering in [his]124-thaddeus sholto head . So shaken was [he]124-thaddeus sholto that [I]0-i had to pass [my]0-i hand under [his]124-thaddeus sholto arm as [we]350-we went up [the stairs]351-the stairs , for [his]124-thaddeus sholto knees were trembling under [him]124-thaddeus sholto . Twice as [we]350-we ascended [Holmes]105-holmes whipped [his]105-holmes lens out of [his]105-holmes pocket and carefully examined marks which appeared to [me]0-i to be mere shapeless smudges of dust upon the cocoa - nut matting which served as a stair - carpet . [He]105-holmes walked slowly from step to step , holding the lamp , and shooting keen glances to right and left . [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan had remained behind with [the frightened housekeeper]352-the frightened housekeeper .

[The third flight of stairs]353-the third flight of stairs ended in a straight passage of some length , with a great picture in Indian tapestry upon the right of [it]353-the third flight of stairs and three doors upon the left . [Holmes]105-holmes advanced along [it]353-the third flight of stairs in the same slow and methodical way , while [we]350-we kept close at [his]105-holmes heels , with [our]350-we long black shadows streaming backwards down [the corridor]354-the corridor . The third door was that which [we]350-we were seeking . [Holmes]105-holmes knocked without receiving any answer , and then tried to turn the handle and force it open . It was locked on the inside , however , and by a broad and powerful bolt , as [we]350-we could see when [we]350-we set [our]350-we lamp up against it . The key being turned , however , the hole was not entirely closed . [Sherlock Holmes]105-holmes bent down to it , and instantly rose again with a sharp intaking of the breath .

" There is something devilish in this , [Watson]106-watson , "[105-holmes] said [he]105-holmes , more moved than [I]0-i had ever before seen [him]105-holmes . " What do [you]106-watson make of it ? "[105-holmes]

[I]0-i stooped to the hole , and recoiled in horror . Moonlight was streaming into [the room]206-the room , and it was bright with a vague and shifty radiance . Looking straight at [me]0-i , and suspended , as it were , in the air , for all beneath was in shadow , there hung a face , the very face of [[our]350-we companion]236-our companion [Thaddeus]124-thaddeus sholto . There was the same high , shining head , the same circular bristle of red hair , the same bloodless countenance . The features were set , however , in a horrible smile , a fixed and unnatural grin , which in [that still and moonlit room]357-that still and moonlit room was more jarring to the nerves than any scowl or contortion . So like was the face to that of [[our]350-we little friend]358-our little friend that [I]0-i looked round at [him]105-holmes to make sure that [he]105-holmes was indeed with [us]350-we . Then [I]0-i recalled to mind that [he]105-holmes had mentioned to [us]350-we that [[his]105-holmes brother]359-his brother and [he]105-holmes were [twins]360-twins .

" This is terrible ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [Holmes]105-holmes . " What is to be done ? "[0-i]

" The door must come down , "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes answered , and , springing against it , [he]105-holmes put all [his]105-holmes weight upon the lock . It creaked and groaned , but did not yield . Together [we]350-we flung [ourselves]350-we upon it once more , and this time it gave way with a sudden snap , and [we]350-we found [ourselves]350-we within [[Bartholomew Sholto]138-bartholomew sholto s chamber]361-bartholomew sholto s chamber .

[It]361-bartholomew sholto s chamber appeared to have been fitted up as [a chemical laboratory]362-a chemical laboratory . A double line of glass - stoppered bottles was drawn up upon the wall opposite the door , and the table was littered over with Bunsen burners , test - tubes , and retorts . In the corners stood carboys of acid in wicker baskets . One of these appeared to leak or to have been broken , for a stream of dark - coloured liquid had trickled out from it , and the air was heavy with a peculiarly pungent , tar - like odour . A set of steps stood at one side of [the room]206-the room , in the midst of a litter of lath and plaster , and above them there was an opening in the ceiling large enough for [a man to pass through]364-a man to pass through . At the foot of the steps a long coil of rope was thrown carelessly together .

By the table , in a wooden arm - chair , [the master of [the house]296-the house]365-the master of the house was seated all in a heap , with [his]365-the master of the house head sunk upon [his]365-the master of the house left shoulder , and that ghastly , inscrutable smile upon [his]365-the master of the house face . [He]365-the master of the house was stiff and cold , and had clearly been dead many hours . It seemed to [me]0-i that not only [his]365-the master of the house features but all [his]365-the master of the house limbs were twisted and turned in the most fantastic fashion . By [his]365-the master of the house hand upon the table there lay a peculiar instrument , a brown , close - grained stick , with a stone head like a hammer , rudely lashed on with coarse twine . Beside it was a torn sheet of note - paper with some words scrawled upon it . [Holmes]105-holmes glanced at it , and then handed it to [me]0-i .

" [You]0-i see , "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes said , with a significant raising of the eyebrows .

In the light of the lantern [I]0-i read , with a thrill of horror , " The sign of the four . "[0-i]

" In [God]139-god s name , what does it all mean ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" It means murder , "[105-holmes] said [he]105-holmes , stooping over [the dead man]367-the dead man . " Ah , [I]105-holmes expected it . Look here ! "[105-holmes] [He]105-holmes pointed to what looked like a long , dark thorn stuck in the skin just above the ear .

" It looks like a thorn , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" It is a thorn . [You]0-i may pick it out . But be careful , for it is poisoned . "[367-the dead man]

[I]0-i took it up between [my]0-i finger and thumb . It came away from the skin so readily that hardly any mark was left behind . One tiny speck of blood showed where the puncture had been .

" This is all an insoluble mystery to [me]0-i , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " It grows darker instead of clearer . "[0-i]

" On the contrary , "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes answered , " it clears every instant . [I]105-holmes only require a few missing links to have an entirely connected case . "[105-holmes]

[We]368-we had almost forgotten [our]368-we companion s presence since [we]368-we entered [the chamber]369-the chamber . [He]105-holmes was still standing in the doorway , the very picture of terror , wringing [his]105-holmes hands and moaning to [himself]105-holmes . " The treasure is gone ! "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes said . " [They]1018-they have robbed [him]105-holmes of the treasure ! There is the hole through which [we]368-we lowered [it]1019-it . " What time was that ? "[105-holmes]

" It was ten o clock . And now [he]105-holmes is dead , and [the police]787-the police will be called in , and [I]105-holmes shall be suspected of having had a hand in it . Chapter VI [Sherlock Holmes]105-holmes Gives a Demonstration

" Now , [Watson]106-watson , "[105-holmes] said [Holmes]105-holmes , rubbing [his]105-holmes hands , " [we]372-we have half an hour to [ourselves]372-we . Let [us]372-we make good use of it . [My]105-holmes case is , as [I]105-holmes have told [you]106-watson , almost complete ; but [we]372-we must not err on the side of over - confidence . Simple as the case seems now , there may be something deeper underlying it . "[105-holmes]

" Simple ! "[0-i] [I]0-i ejaculated .

" Surely , "[105-holmes] said [he]105-holmes , with something of the air of [a clinical professor]373-a clinical professor expounding to [[his]105-holmes class]374-his class . " Just sit in the corner there , that [your]106-watson footprints may not complicate matters . Now to work ! In the first place , how did [these folk]1029-these folk come , and how did [they]1029-these folk go ? The door has not been opened since last night . How of the window ? "[105-holmes] [He]105-holmes carried the lamp across to it , muttering [his]105-holmes observations aloud the while , but addressing them to [himself]105-holmes rather than to [me]0-i . " Window is snibbed on the inner side . Framework is solid . No hinges at the side . Let [us]372-we open it . No water - pipe near . Roof quite out of reach . Yet [a man]736-a man has mounted by the window . It rained a little last night . Here is the print of a foot in mould upon the sill . And here is a circular muddy mark , and here again upon the floor , and here again by the table . See here , [Watson]106-watson ! This is really a very pretty demonstration . "[105-holmes]

[I]0-i looked at the round , well - defined muddy discs . " This is not a footmark , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" It is something much more valuable to [us]372-we . It is the impression of a wooden stump . [You]106-watson see here on the sill is the boot - mark , a heavy boot with the broad metal heel , and beside it is the mark of the timber - toe . "[105-holmes]

" It is [the wooden - legged man]1031-the wooden - legged man . "[0-i]

" Quite so . But there has been [some one else]1032-some one else , [a very able and efficient ally]1033-a very able and efficient ally . Could [you]106-watson scale that wall , [doctor]761-doctor ? "[105-holmes]

[I]0-i looked out of the open window . The moon still shone brightly on that angle of [the house]296-the house . [We]376-we were a good sixty feet from the ground , and , look where [I]0-i would , [I]0-i could see no foothold , nor as much as a crevice in the brick - work .

" It is absolutely impossible , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" Without aid it is so . "[377-i]

"[105-holmes]

[He]105-holmes mounted the steps , and , seizing a rafter with either hand , [he]105-holmes swung [himself]105-holmes up into [the garret]378-the garret . Then , lying on [his]105-holmes face , [he]105-holmes reached down for the lamp and held it while [I]0-i followed [him]105-holmes .

[The chamber in which [we]380-we found [ourselves]380-we]379-the chamber in which we found ourselves was about ten feet one way and six the other . The floor was formed by the rafters , with thin lath - and - plaster between , so that in walking one had to step from beam to beam . The roof ran up to an apex , and was evidently the inner shell of the true roof of [the house]296-the house . There was no furniture of any sort , and the accumulated dust of years lay thick upon the floor .

" Here [you]0-i are , [you]0-i see , "[105-holmes] said [Sherlock Holmes]105-holmes , putting [his]105-holmes hand against the sloping wall . " This is a trap - door which leads out on to the roof . [He]105-holmes held down the lamp to the floor , and as [he]105-holmes did so [I]0-i saw for the second time that night a startled , surprised look come over [his]105-holmes face . " [Holmes]105-holmes , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , in a whisper , " [a child]774-a child has done the horrid thing . "[0-i]

[He]105-holmes had recovered [his]105-holmes self - possession in an instant . " [I]105-holmes was staggered for the moment , "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes said , " but the thing is quite natural . " What is [your]105-holmes theory , then , as to those footmarks ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , eagerly , when [we]383-us had regained [the lower room]384-the lower room once more .

" [I]0-i can not conceive anything which will cover the facts , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" It will be clear enough to [you]106-watson soon , "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes said , in an off - hand way . "[105-holmes] [He]105-holmes whipped out [his]105-holmes lens and a tape measure , and hurried about [the room]206-the room on [his]105-holmes knees , measuring , comparing , examining , with [his]105-holmes long thin nose only a few inches from the planks , and [his]105-holmes beady eyes gleaming and deep - set like those of a bird . As [he]105-holmes hunted about , [he]105-holmes kept muttering to [himself]105-holmes , and finally [he]105-holmes broke out into a loud crow of delight .

" [We]1054-we are certainly in luck , "[105-holmes] said [he]105-holmes . " [We]1054-we ought to have very little trouble now . [The carboy]1056-the carboy has been cracked , [You]0-i see , and the stuff has leaked out . "[105-holmes]

" What then ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Why , [we]1054-we have got [him]140-number one , that s all , "[105-holmes] said [he]105-holmes . " [I]105-holmes know a dog that would follow that scent to [the world s end]1057-the world s end . It sounds like a sum in the rule of three . The answer should give [us]1054-we the But halloa ! here are [the accredited representatives of the law]1060-the accredited representatives of the law . "[105-holmes]

Heavy steps and the clamour of loud voices were audible from below , and the hall door shut with a loud crash .

" Before [they]1060-the accredited representatives of the law come , "[105-holmes] said [Holmes]105-holmes , " just put [your]0-i hand here on [this poor fellow]1061-this poor fellow s arm , and here on [his]1061-this poor fellow leg . What do [you]0-i feel ? "[105-holmes]

" The muscles are as hard as a board , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" Quite so . [They]1060-the accredited representatives of the law are in a state of extreme contraction , far exceeding the usual _ rigor mortis _ . Coupled with this distortion of the face , this Hippocratic smile , or _ risus sardonicus _ , as [the old writers]1062-the old writers called it , what conclusion would it suggest to [your]0-i mind ? "[105-holmes]

" Death from some powerful vegetable alkaloid , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " some strychnine - like substance which would produce tetanus . "[0-i]

" That was the idea which occurred to [me]105-holmes the instant [I]105-holmes saw the drawn muscles of the face . On getting into [the room]206-the room [I]105-holmes at once looked for the means by which the poison had entered the system . As [you]0-i saw , [I]105-holmes discovered a thorn which had been driven or shot with no great force into the scalp . [You]0-i observe that the part struck was that which would be turned towards the hole in the ceiling if [the man]287-the man were erect in [his]287-the man chair . Now examine the thorn . "[105-holmes]

[I]0-i took it up gingerly and held it in the light of the lantern . It was long , sharp , and black , with a glazed look near the point as though some gummy substance had dried upon it . The blunt end had been trimmed and rounded off with a knife .

" Is that an English thorn ? "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes asked .

" No , it certainly is not . "[388-a very stout , portly man in a grey suit]

" With all these data [you]0-i should be able to draw some just inference . But here are [the regulars]1065-the regulars ; so [the auxiliary forces]1066-the auxiliary forces may beat a retreat . "[388-a very stout , portly man in a grey suit]

As [he]105-holmes spoke , the steps which had been coming nearer sounded loudly on [the passage]306-the passage , and [a very stout , portly man in a grey suit]388-a very stout , portly man in a grey suit strode heavily into [the room]206-the room . [He]388-a very stout , portly man in a grey suit was red - faced , burly and plethoric , with a pair of very small twinkling eyes which looked keenly out from between swollen and puffy pouches . [He]388-a very stout , portly man in a grey suit was closely followed by [an inspector in uniform]390-an inspector in uniform , and by the still palpitating [Thaddeus Sholto]124-thaddeus sholto .

" Here s a business ! "[388-a very stout , portly man in a grey suit] [he]388-a very stout , portly man in a grey suit cried , in a muffled , husky voice . " Here s a pretty business ! Chapter VII The Episode of [the Barrel

The police]404-the barrel the police had brought [a cab]405-a cab with [them]404-the barrel the police , and in this [I]0-i escorted [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan back to [[her]112-miss morstan home]406-her home . After the angelic fashion of [women]407-women , [she]112-miss morstan had borne trouble with a calm face as long as there was some one weaker than [herself]112-miss morstan to support , and [I]0-i had found [her]112-miss morstan bright and placid by the side of [the frightened housekeeper]352-the frightened housekeeper . In [the cab]234-the cab , however , [she]112-miss morstan first turned faint , and then burst into a passion of weeping , so sorely had [she]112-miss morstan been tried by the adventures of the night . [She]112-miss morstan has told [me]0-i since that [she]112-miss morstan thought [me]0-i cold and distant upon that journey . [She]112-miss morstan little guessed the struggle within [my]0-i breast , or the effort of self - restraint which held [me]0-i back . [My]0-i sympathies and [my]0-i love went out to [her]112-miss morstan , even as [my]0-i hand had in [the garden]944-the garden . [I]0-i felt that years of the conventionalities of life could not teach [me]0-i to know [her]112-miss morstan sweet , brave nature as had this one day of strange experiences . Yet there were two thoughts which sealed the words of affection upon [my]0-i lips . [She]112-miss morstan was weak and helpless , shaken in mind and nerve . It was to take [her]112-miss morstan at a disadvantage to obtrude love upon [her]112-miss morstan at such a time . Worse still , [she]112-miss morstan was rich . If [Holmes]105-holmes s researches were successful , [she]112-miss morstan would be [an heiress]411-an heiress . Was it fair , was it honourable , that [a half - pay surgeon]412-a half - pay surgeon should take such advantage of an intimacy which chance had brought about ? Might [she]112-miss morstan not look upon [me]0-i as [a mere vulgar fortune - seeker]413-a mere vulgar fortune - seeker ? [I]0-i could not bear to risk that such a thought should cross [her]112-miss morstan mind . This Agra treasure intervened like an impassable barrier between [us]414-us .

It was nearly two o clock when [we]414-us reached [Mrs. Cecil Forrester]114-mrs. cecil forrester s. [The servants]415-the servants had retired hours ago , but [Mrs. Forrester]114-mrs. cecil forrester had been so interested by the strange message which [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan had received that [she]112-miss morstan had sat up in the hope of [her]112-miss morstan return . [She]112-miss morstan opened the door [herself]112-miss morstan , [a middle - aged , graceful woman]416-a middle - aged , graceful woman , and it gave [me]0-i joy to see how tenderly [her]112-miss morstan arm stole round the other s waist and how motherly was the voice in which [she]112-miss morstan greeted [her]112-miss morstan . [She]112-miss morstan was clearly [no mere paid dependant]417-no mere paid dependant , but [an honoured friend]418-an honoured friend . [I]0-i was introduced , and [Mrs. Forrester]114-mrs. cecil forrester earnestly begged [me]0-i to step in and tell [her]112-miss morstan [our]419-we adventures . [I]0-i explained , however , the importance of [my]0-i errand , and promised faithfully to call and report any progress which [we]419-we might make with the case . As [we]419-we drove away [I]0-i stole a glance back , and [I]0-i still seem to see [that little group on the step]420-that little group on the step , [the two graceful , clinging figures]421-the two graceful , clinging figures , the half - opened door , the hall - light shining through stained glass , the barometer , and the bright stair - rods . It was soothing to catch even that passing glimpse of [a tranquil English home]422-a tranquil english home in the midst of the wild , dark business which had absorbed [us]419-we .

And the more [I]0-i thought of what had happened , the wilder and darker it grew . [I]0-i reviewed the whole extraordinary sequence of events as [I]0-i rattled on through [the silent gas - lit streets]423-the silent gas - lit streets . There was the original problem : that at least was pretty clear now . [They]424-they had only led [us]419-we , however , to a deeper and far more tragic mystery . The Indian treasure , the curious plan found among [Morstan]115-captain morstan s baggage , the strange scene at [Major Sholto]116-major sholto s death , the rediscovery of the treasure immediately followed by the murder of [the discoverer]425-the discoverer , the very singular accompaniments to the crime , the footsteps , the remarkable weapons , the words upon the card , corresponding with those upon [Captain Morstan]115-captain morstan s chart , here was indeed a labyrinth in which [a man less singularly endowed than [[my]0-i fellow - lodger]427-my fellow - lodger]426-a man less singularly endowed than my fellow - lodger might well despair of ever finding the clue .

" [I]105-holmes wish [you]0-i particularly to notice these footmarks , "[105-holmes] [he]105-holmes said . " Do [you]0-i observe anything noteworthy about them ? "[105-holmes]

" Apart from [their]1142-their size , though . Is there nothing else ? "[105-holmes]

" They appear to be much as other footmarks . "[0-i]

" Not at all . Look here ! This is the print of a right foot in the dust . Now [I]105-holmes make one with [my]105-holmes naked foot beside it . What is the chief difference ? "[105-holmes]

" [Your]0-i toes are all cramped together . The other print has each toe distinctly divided . "[0-i]

" Quite so . That is the point . Bear that in mind . Now , would [you]0-i kindly step over to that flap - window and smell the edge of the wood - work ? [I]105-holmes shall stay here , as [I]105-holmes have this handkerchief in [my]105-holmes hand . "[105-holmes]

[I]0-i did as [he]105-holmes directed , and was instantly conscious of a strong tarry smell .

" That is where [he]105-holmes put [his]105-holmes foot in getting out . If _ [you]0-i _ can trace [him]105-holmes , [I]105-holmes should think that [Toby]143-toby will have no difficulty . Now run [downstairs]1021-downstairs , loose the dog , and look out for [Blondin]146-blondin . "[105-holmes]

"[105-holmes] [He]105-holmes pushed the creasote handkerchief under the dog s nose , while the creature stood with its fluffy legs separated , and with a most comical cock to its head , like a connoisseur sniffing the _ bouquet _ of a famous vintage . [The creature]454-the creature instantly broke into a succession of high , tremulous yelps , and , with [his]105-holmes nose on the ground , and [his]105-holmes tail in the air , pattered off upon [the trail]455-the trail at a pace which strained [his]105-holmes leash and kept [us]456-us at the top of [our]456-us speed .

The east had been gradually whitening , and [we]456-us could now see some distance in the cold grey light . [The square , massive house]457-the square , massive house , with [its]457-the square , massive house black , empty windows and high , bare walls , towered up , sad and forlorn , behind [us]456-us . On reaching the boundary wall [Toby]143-toby ran along , whining eagerly , underneath its shadow , and stopped finally in a corner screened by a young beech . Where the two walls joined , several bricks had been loosened , and the crevices left were worn down and rounded upon the lower side , as though they had frequently been used as a ladder . "[105-holmes]

[We]463-we had during this time been following the guidance of [Toby]143-toby down [the half - rural villa - lined roads which lead to [the metropolis]465-the metropolis]464-the half - rural villa - lined roads which lead to the metropolis . Strange dogs sauntered up and stared wonderingly at [us]463-we as [we]463-we passed , but [our]463-we inimitable [Toby]143-toby looked neither to the right nor to the left , but trotted onwards with [his]143-toby nose to the ground and an occasional eager whine which spoke of a hot scent .

[We]463-we had traversed [Streatham]35-streatham , [Brixton]36-brixton , [Camberwell]37-camberwell , and now found [ourselves]463-we in [Kennington Lane]38-kennington lane , having borne away through [the side - streets to the east of [the Oval]473-the oval]472-the side - streets to the east of the oval . [The men whom [we]463-we pursued]474-the men whom we pursued seemed to have taken [a curiously zigzag road]475-a curiously zigzag road , with the idea probably of escaping observation . " What the deuce is the matter with the dog ? "[105-holmes] growled [Holmes]105-holmes . " [They]474-the men whom we pursued surely would not take [a cab]405-a cab , or go off in a balloon . "[105-holmes]

" Perhaps [they]474-the men whom we pursued stood [here]996-here for some time , "[0-i] [I]0-i suggested .

" Ah ! it s all right . [He]143-toby s off again , "[195-my companion] said [[my]0-i companion]195-my companion , in a tone of relief .

[He]143-toby was indeed off , for after sniffing round again [he]143-toby suddenly made up [his]143-toby mind , and darted away with an energy and determination such as [he]143-toby had not yet shown . The scent appeared to be much hotter than before , for [he]143-toby had not even to put [his]143-toby nose on the ground , but tugged at [his]143-toby leash and tried to break into a run . [I]0-i cold see by the gleam in [Holmes]105-holmes s eyes that [he]105-holmes thought [we]481-we were nearing the end of [our]481-we journey .

[Our]481-we course now ran down [Nine Elms]42-nine elms until [we]481-we came to [Broderick]43-broderick and [[Nelson]154-nelson s large timber - yard]482-nelson s large timber - yard , just past [the White Eagle tavern]483-the white eagle tavern . Here the dog , frantic with excitement , turned down through the side - gate into [the enclosure]484-the enclosure , where [the sawyers]485-the sawyers were already at work . On the dog raced through sawdust and shavings , down [an alley]486-an alley , round [a passage]487-a passage , between two wood - piles , and finally , with a triumphant yelp , sprang upon a large barrel which still stood upon the hand - trolley on which it had been brought . With lolling tongue and blinking eyes , [Toby]143-toby stood upon the cask , looking from one to the other of [us]481-we for some sign of appreciation . The staves of the barrel and the wheels of [the trolley]488-the trolley were smeared with a dark liquid , and the whole air was heavy with the smell of creasote .

[[Sherlock Holmes]105-holmes]489-sherlock holmes and [I]0-i looked blankly at [each other]902-each other , and then burst simultaneously into an uncontrollable fit of laughter .

Chapter VIII [The Baker Street Irregulars]491-the baker street irregulars

" What now ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " [Toby]143-toby has lost [his]143-toby character for infallibility . "[0-i]

" [He]143-toby acted according to [his]143-toby lights , "[105-holmes] said [Holmes]105-holmes , lifting [him]143-toby down from the barrel and walking [him]143-toby out of [the timber - yard]492-the timber - yard . " If [you]1218-you consider how much creasote is carted about [London]8-london in one day , it is no great wonder that [our]481-we trail should have been crossed . It is much used now , especially for the seasoning of wood . [Poor Toby]143-toby is not to blame . "[105-holmes]

" [We]481-we must get on the main scent again , [I]143-toby suppose . "[143-toby]

" Yes . And , fortunately , [we]481-we have no distance to go . Evidently what puzzled the dog at [the corner of [Knight s Place]41-knight s place]1219-the corner of knight s place was that there were [two different trails]1220-two different trails running in opposite directions . [We]481-we took the wrong one . It only remains to follow the other . "[105-holmes]

There was no difficulty about this . On leading [Toby]143-toby to [the place where [he]143-toby had committed [his]143-toby fault]493-the place where he had committed his fault , [he]143-toby cast about in a wide circle and finally dashed off in a fresh direction .

" [We]481-we must take care that [he]143-toby does not now bring [us]481-we to the place where the creasote - barrel came from , "[0-i] [I]0-i observed .

" [I]143-toby had thought of that . But [you]1221-you notice that [he]143-toby keeps on [the pavement]733-the pavement , whereas the barrel passed down [the roadway]1223-the roadway . No , [we]481-we are on the true scent now . "[143-toby]

It tended down towards [the river - side]494-the river - side , running through [Belmont Place]44-belmont place and [Prince s Street]45-prince s street . At the end of [Broad Street]46-broad street [it]495-it ran right down to the water s edge , where there was [a small wooden wharf]496-a small wooden wharf . [Toby]143-toby led [us]497-us to the very edge of this , and there stood whining , looking out on the dark current beyond .

" [We]497-us are out of luck , "[105-holmes] said [Holmes]105-holmes . " [They]1224-they have taken to [a boat]1225-a boat [here]996-here . "[105-holmes] Several small punts and skiffs were lying about in [the water]498-the water and on the edge of [the wharf]499-the wharf . [We]497-us took [Toby]143-toby round to each in turn , but , though [he]143-toby sniffed earnestly , [he]143-toby made no sign .

Close to [the rude landing - stage]500-the rude landing - stage was [a small brick house]501-a small brick house , with a wooden placard slung out through the second window . " [Mordecai Smith]155-mordecai smith "[105-holmes] was printed across it in large letters , and , underneath , " Boats to hire by the hour or day . "[105-holmes] A second inscription above the door informed [us]497-us that a steam launch was kept , a statement which was confirmed by a great pile of coke upon [the jetty]502-the jetty . [Sherlock Holmes]105-holmes looked slowly round , and [his]105-holmes face assumed an ominous expression .

It was between eight and nine o clock now , and [I]0-i was conscious of a strong reaction after the successive excitements of the night . [I]0-i was limp and weary , befogged in mind and fatigued in body . [I]0-i had not the professional enthusiasm which carried [[my]0-i companion]195-my companion on , nor could [I]0-i look at the matter as a mere abstract intellectual problem . While there was a chance of recovering it [I]0-i was ready to devote [my]0-i life to the one object . True , if [I]0-i found it it would probably put [her]112-miss morstan forever beyond [my]0-i reach . Yet it would be a petty and selfish love which would be influenced by such a thought as that . If [Holmes]105-holmes could work to find [the criminals]514-the criminals , [I]0-i had a tenfold stronger reason to urge [me]0-i on to find the treasure .

" About twelve o clock last night , "[138-bartholomew sholto] said the _ Standard _ , " [Mr. Bartholomew Sholto]138-bartholomew sholto , of [Pondicherry Lodge]25-pondicherry lodge , [Upper Norwood]11-upper norwood , was found dead in [[his]138-bartholomew sholto room]927-his room under circumstances which point to foul play . This fact , which has been very clearly made out , proves conclusively that it was no mere haphazard burglary . The prompt and energetic action of [the officers of the law]1324-the officers of the law shows the great advantage of the presence on such occasions of a single vigorous and masterful mind . The average height is rather below four feet , although [many full - grown adults]1367-many full - grown adults may be found who are very much smaller than this . [They]1367-many full - grown adults are [a fierce , morose , and intractable people , though capable of forming most devoted friendships when [their]1367-many full - grown adults confidence has once been gained]1368-a fierce , morose , and intractable people , though capable of forming most devoted friendships when their confidence has once been gained . Mark that , [Watson]106-watson . Now , then , listen to this . [They]1367-many full - grown adults are naturally hideous , having large , misshapen heads , small , fierce eyes , and distorted features . [Their]1367-many full - grown adults feet and hands , however , are remarkably small . So intractable and fierce are [they]1367-many full - grown adults that all the efforts of [the British official]1369-the british official have failed to win [them]1367-many full - grown adults over in any degree . [They]1367-many full - grown adults have always been a terror to [shipwrecked crews]1370-shipwrecked crews , braining [the survivors]1371-the survivors with [their]1367-many full - grown adults stone - headed clubs , or shooting [them]1371-the survivors with [their]1367-many full - grown adults poisoned arrows . These massacres are invariably concluded by a cannibal feast . [Nice , amiable people]1372-nice , amiable people , [Watson]106-watson ! If [this fellow]1373-this fellow had been left to [his]1373-this fellow own unaided devices this affair might have taken an even more ghastly turn . [I]526-i fancy that , even as it is , [Jonathan Small]118-jonathan small would give a good deal not to have employed [him]1373-this fellow . "[526-i]

" But how came [he]1373-this fellow to have so singular [a companion]1374-a companion ? "[527-his]

" Ah , that is more than [I]526-i can tell . [He]527-his took up [his]527-his violin from the corner , and as [I]0-i stretched [myself]0-i out [he]527-his began to play some low , dreamy , melodious air , [his]527-his own , no doubt , for [he]527-his had a remarkable gift for improvisation . [Chapter IX]162-chapter ix A Break in the Chain

[Chapter X]166-chapter x The End of [the Islander]563-the islander

[Our]564-we meal was a merry one . [Holmes]105-holmes could talk exceedingly well when [he]105-holmes chose , and that night [he]105-holmes did choose . [He]105-holmes appeared to be in a state of nervous exaltation . [I]0-i have never known [him]105-holmes so brilliant . [He]105-holmes spoke on a quick succession of subjects , on miracle - plays , on medi val pottery , on Stradivarius violins , on the Buddhism of [Ceylon]68-ceylon , and on the war - ships of the future , handling each as though [he]105-holmes had made a special study of it . [His]105-holmes bright humour marked the reaction from [his]105-holmes black depression of the preceding days . " [We]577-we have no right to take anything for granted , "[105-holmes] [Holmes]105-holmes answered . " [They]1532-they are coming from work in [the yard]1522-the yard . "[105-holmes]

" [Dirty - looking rascals]1536-dirty - looking rascals , but [I]105-holmes suppose [every one]1291-every one has some little immortal spark concealed about [him]1291-every one . " [Some one]1540-some one calls [him]1539-a strange enigma is man [a soul concealed in an animal]1541-a soul concealed in an animal , "[0-i] [I]0-i suggested .

" [Winwood Reade]117-winwood reade is good upon the subject , "[105-holmes] said [Holmes]105-holmes . " [He]117-winwood reade remarks that , while [the individual man]1542-the individual man is an insoluble puzzle , in the aggregate [he]1539-a strange enigma is man becomes a mathematical certainty . [You]1538-you can , for example , never foretell what [any one man]1543-any one man will do , but [you]1538-you can say with precision what an average number will be up to . " And there is [the _ Aurora _]1278-the _ aurora _ , "[105-holmes] exclaimed [Holmes]105-holmes , " and going like the devil ! Full speed ahead , [engineer]1548-engineer . [She]583-her had slipped unseen through [the yard - entrance]584-the yard - entrance and passed behind [two or three small craft]585-two or three small craft , so that [she]583-her had fairly got [her]583-her speed up before [we]586-we saw [her]583-her . [We]589-we were fairly after [her]583-her now . The furnaces roared , and the powerful engines whizzed and clanked , like a great metallic heart . [Her]583-her sharp , steep prow cut through [the river - water]590-the river - water and sent two rolling waves to right and to left of [us]589-we . With every throb of the engines [we]589-we sprang and quivered like a living thing . One great yellow lantern in [our]589-we bows threw a long , flickering funnel of light in front of [us]589-we . [We]589-we flashed past [barges]593-barges , [steamers]594-steamers , [merchant - vessels]595-merchant - vessels , in and out , behind [this one]596-this one and round the other . Voices hailed [us]589-we out of the darkness , but still [the _ Aurora _]1278-the _ aurora _ thundered on , and still [we]589-we followed close upon [her]583-her track .

[Our]589-we boilers were strained to their utmost , and the frail shell vibrated and creaked with the fierce energy which was driving [us]589-we along . [The boy]609-the boy held the tiller , while against the red glare of the furnace [I]0-i could see [old Smith]164-smith , stripped to the waist , and shovelling coals for dear life . [They]610-them may have had some doubt at first as to whether [we]589-we were really pursuing [them]610-them , but now as [we]589-we followed every winding and turning which [they]610-them took there could no longer be any question about it . [The man in the stern]615-the man in the stern still crouched upon [the deck]616-the deck , and [his]615-the man in the stern arms were moving as though [he]615-the man in the stern were busy , while every now and then [he]615-the man in the stern would look up and measure with a glance the distance which still separated [us]589-we . [We]627-we were round after [her]637-her in an instant , but [she]637-her was already nearly at [the bank]638-the bank . The launch with a dull thud ran up upon [the mud - bank]641-the mud - bank , with [her]637-her bow in the air and [her]637-her stern flush with the water . [The fugitive]642-the fugitive sprang out , but [his]642-the fugitive stump instantly sank its whole length into the sodden soil . In vain [he]642-the fugitive struggled and writhed . Not one step could [he]642-the fugitive possibly take either forwards or backwards . [He]642-the fugitive yelled in impotent rage , and kicked frantically into the mud with [his]642-the fugitive other foot , but [his]642-the fugitive struggles only bored [his]642-the fugitive wooden pin the deeper into the sticky bank . When [we]627-we brought [our]627-we launch alongside [he]642-the fugitive was so firmly anchored that it was only by throwing the end of a rope over [his]642-the fugitive shoulders that [we]627-we were able to haul [him]642-the fugitive out , and to drag [him]642-the fugitive , like some evil fish , over [our]627-we side . [The _ Aurora]168-the _ aurora _ [herself]168-the _ aurora [we]627-we hauled off and made fast to [our]627-we stern . A solid iron chest of Indian workmanship stood upon the deck . " See here , "[105-holmes] said [Holmes]105-holmes , pointing to the wooden hatchway . " [We]627-we were hardly quick enough with [our]627-we pistols . "[105-holmes] There , sure enough , just behind where [we]627-we had been standing , stuck one of those murderous darts which [we]627-we knew so well . [[Our]627-we captive]651-our captive sat in [the cabin]652-the cabin opposite to the iron box which [he]651-our captive had done so much and waited so long to gain . [He]651-our captive was [a sunburned , reckless - eyed fellow]653-a sunburned , reckless - eyed fellow , with a network of lines and wrinkles all over [his]651-our captive mahogany features , which told of a hard , open - air life . [His]651-our captive age may have been fifty or thereabouts , for [his]651-our captive black , curly hair was thickly shot with grey . [His]651-our captive face in repose was not an unpleasing one , though [his]651-our captive heavy brows and aggressive chin gave [him]651-our captive , as [I]0-i had lately seen , a terrible expression when moved to anger . [She]112-miss morstan was seated by the open window , dressed in some sort of white diaphanous material , with a little touch of scarlet at the neck and waist . The soft light of a shaded lamp fell upon [her]112-miss morstan as [she]112-miss morstan leaned back in the basket chair , playing over [her]112-miss morstan sweet , grave face , and tinting with a dull , metallic sparkle the rich coils of [her]112-miss morstan luxuriant hair . One white arm and hand drooped over the side of the chair , and [her]112-miss morstan whole pose and figure spoke of an absorbing melancholy . At the sound of [my]0-i foot - fall [she]112-miss morstan sprang to [her]112-miss morstan feet , however , and a bright flush of surprise and of pleasure coloured [her]112-miss morstan pale cheeks .

" [I]112-miss morstan heard [a cab drive up]1589-a cab drive up , "[112-miss morstan] [she]112-miss morstan said . " [I]112-miss morstan thought that [Mrs. Forrester]114-mrs. cecil forrester had come back very early , but [I]112-miss morstan never dreamed that it might be [you]0-i . What news have [you]0-i brought [me]112-miss morstan ? "[112-miss morstan]

" [I]0-i have brought something better than news , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , putting down the box upon the table and speaking jovially and boisterously , though [my]0-i heart was heavy within [me]0-i . " [I]0-i have brought [you]0-i something which is worth all the news in [the world]706-the world . [I]0-i have brought [you]0-i a fortune . "[0-i]

[She]112-miss morstan glanced at the iron box . " Is that the treasure , then ? "[112-miss morstan] [she]112-miss morstan asked , coolly enough .

" Yes , this is the great Agra treasure . Half of it is [yours]0-i and half is [Thaddeus Sholto]124-thaddeus sholto s. [You]0-i will have a couple of hundred thousand each . Think of that ! An annuity of ten thousand pounds . There will be [few richer young ladies in [England]6-england]1591-few richer young ladies in england . Is it not glorious ? "[112-miss morstan]

[I]0-i think that [I]0-i must have been rather overacting [my]0-i delight , and that [she]112-miss morstan detected a hollow ring in [my]0-i congratulations , for [I]0-i saw [her]112-miss morstan eyebrows rise a little , and [she]112-miss morstan glanced at [me]0-i curiously .

" If [I]112-miss morstan have it , "[112-miss morstan] said [she]112-miss morstan , " [I]112-miss morstan owe it to [you]0-i . "[112-miss morstan]

" No , no , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " not to [me]0-i , but to [[my]0-i friend]1445-my friend [Sherlock Holmes]105-holmes . With all the will in [the world]706-the world , [I]0-i could never have followed up a clue which has taxed even [his]105-holmes analytical genius . As it was , [we]671-our very nearly lost it at the last moment . "[0-i]

" Pray sit down and tell [me]112-miss morstan all about it , [Dr. Watson]106-watson , "[112-miss morstan] said [she]112-miss morstan .

[I]0-i narrated briefly what had occurred since [I]0-i had seen [her]112-miss morstan last , [Holmes]105-holmes s new method of search , the discovery of [the _ Aurora _]1278-the _ aurora _ , the appearance of [Athelney Jones]109-jones , [our]671-our expedition in the evening , and the wild chase down [the Thames]17-the thames . [She]112-miss morstan listened with parted lips and shining eyes to [my]0-i recital of [our]671-our adventures . When [I]0-i spoke of the dart which had so narrowly missed [us]671-our , [she]112-miss morstan turned so white that [I]0-i feared that [she]112-miss morstan was about to faint .

" It is nothing , "[112-miss morstan] [she]112-miss morstan said , as [I]0-i hastened to pour [her]112-miss morstan out some water . " [I]112-miss morstan am all right again . It was a shock to [me]112-miss morstan to hear that [I]112-miss morstan had placed [[my]112-miss morstan friends]863-my friends in such horrible peril . "[112-miss morstan]

" That is all over , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " It was nothing . [I]0-i will tell [you]112-miss morstan no more gloomy details . Let [us]671-our turn to something brighter . There is the treasure . What could be brighter than that ? [I]0-i got leave to bring it with [me]0-i , thinking that it would interest [you]112-miss morstan to be the first to see it . "[0-i]

" It would be of the greatest interest to [me]112-miss morstan , "[112-miss morstan] [she]112-miss morstan said . There was no eagerness in [her]112-miss morstan voice , however . It had struck [her]112-miss morstan , doubtless , that it might seem ungracious upon [her]112-miss morstan part to be indifferent to a prize which had cost so much to win .

" What a pretty box ! "[112-miss morstan] [she]112-miss morstan said , stooping over it . " This is Indian work , [I]112-miss morstan suppose ? "[112-miss morstan]

" Yes ; it is [Benares]174-benares metal - work . "[112-miss morstan]

" And so heavy ! "[112-miss morstan] [she]112-miss morstan exclaimed , trying to raise it . " The box alone must be of some value . Where is the key ? "[112-miss morstan]

" [Small]1595-small threw it into [the Thames]17-the thames , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " [I]112-miss morstan must borrow [Mrs. Forrester]114-mrs. cecil forrester s poker . "[112-miss morstan] There was in the front a thick and broad hasp , wrought in the image of a sitting Buddha . Under this [I]0-i thrust the end of the poker and twisted it outward as a lever . The hasp sprang open with a loud snap . With trembling fingers [I]0-i flung back the lid . [We]672-we both stood gazing in astonishment . The box was empty !

No wonder that it was heavy . The iron - work was two - thirds of an inch thick all round . It was massive , well made , and solid , like a chest constructed to carry things of great price , but not one shred or crumb of metal or jewelry lay within [it]673-it . It was absolutely and completely empty .

" The treasure is lost , "[112-miss morstan] said [Miss Morstan]112-miss morstan , calmly .

As [I]0-i listened to the words and realised what they meant , a great shadow seemed to pass from [my]0-i soul . [I]0-i did not know how this Agra treasure had weighed [me]0-i down , until now that it was finally removed . It was selfish , no doubt , disloyal , wrong , but [I]0-i could realise nothing save that the golden barrier was gone from between [us]672-we . " Thank [God]139-god ! "[0-i] [I]0-i ejaculated from [my]0-i very heart .

[She]112-miss morstan looked at [me]0-i with a quick , questioning smile . " Why do [you]0-i say that ? "[112-miss morstan] [she]112-miss morstan asked .

" Because [you]112-miss morstan are within [my]0-i reach again , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , taking [her]112-miss morstan hand . [She]112-miss morstan did not withdraw it . " Because [I]112-miss morstan love [you]112-miss morstan , [Mary]112-miss morstan , as truly as ever [a man]736-a man loved [a woman]1597-a woman . Because this treasure , these riches , sealed [my]112-miss morstan lips . Now that they are gone [I]112-miss morstan can tell [you]112-miss morstan how [I]112-miss morstan love [you]112-miss morstan . That is why [I]112-miss morstan said , Thank [God]139-god . "[112-miss morstan]

" Then [I]112-miss morstan say , Thank [God]139-god , too , "[112-miss morstan] [she]112-miss morstan whispered , as [I]0-i drew [her]112-miss morstan to [my]0-i side . Whoever had lost a treasure , [I]0-i knew that night that [I]0-i had gained one .

Chapter XII The Strange Story of [Jonathan Small]118-jonathan small

[A very patient man]674-a very patient man was [that inspector in [the cab]234-the cab]675-that inspector in the cab , for it was a weary time before [I]0-i rejoined [him]674-a very patient man . [His]674-a very patient man face clouded over when [I]0-i showed [him]674-a very patient man the empty box .

" There goes the reward ! "[674-a very patient man] said [he]674-a very patient man , gloomily . " Where there is no money there is no pay . This night s work would have been worth a tenner each to [Sam Brown]175-sam brown and [me]674-a very patient man if the treasure had been there . "[674-a very patient man]

" [Mr. Thaddeus Sholto]124-thaddeus sholto is [a rich man]1598-a rich man , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [He]124-thaddeus sholto will see that [you]674-a very patient man are rewarded , treasure or no . "[0-i]

[The inspector]677-the inspector shook [his]677-the inspector head despondently , however . " It s a bad job , "[677-the inspector] [he]677-the inspector repeated ; " and so [Mr. Athelney Jones]109-jones will think . "[677-the inspector]

[His]677-the inspector forecast proved to be correct , for [the detective]400-the detective looked blank enough when [I]0-i got to [Baker Street]51-baker street and showed [him]674-a very patient man the empty box . [They]679-they had only just arrived , [Holmes]105-holmes , [the prisoner]680-the prisoner , and [he]677-the inspector , for [they]679-they had changed [their]679-they plans so far as to report [themselves]679-they at [a station upon the way]681-a station upon the way . [[My]0-i companion]195-my companion lounged in [his]195-my companion arm - chair with [his]195-my companion usual listless expression , while [Small]118-jonathan small sat stolidly opposite to [him]195-my companion with [his]118-jonathan small wooden leg cocked over [his]118-jonathan small sound one . As [I]0-i exhibited the empty box [he]195-my companion leaned back in [his]195-my companion chair and laughed aloud .

" This is [your]118-jonathan small doing , [Small]1599-small , "[109-jones] said [Athelney Jones]109-jones , angrily .

" Yes , [I]195-my companion have put it away where [you]118-jonathan small shall never lay hand upon it , "[195-my companion] [he]195-my companion cried , exultantly . " It is [my]195-my companion treasure ; and if [I]195-my companion can t have the loot [I]195-my companion ll take darned good care that [no one else]1268-no one else does . [I]195-my companion tell [you]118-jonathan small that [no living man]1601-no living man has any right to it , unless it is [three men who are in [the Andaman convict - barracks]1603-the andaman convict - barracks and [myself]195-my companion]1602-three men who are in the andaman convict - barracks and myself . [I]195-my companion know now that [I]195-my companion can not have the use of it , and [I]195-my companion know that [they]1602-three men who are in the andaman convict - barracks and myself can not . [I]195-my companion have acted all through for [them]1602-three men who are in the andaman convict - barracks and myself as much as for [myself]195-my companion . It s been the sign of four with [us]1604-us always . Well [I]195-my companion know that [they]1602-three men who are in the andaman convict - barracks and myself would have had [me]195-my companion do just what [I]195-my companion have done , and throw the treasure into [the Thames]17-the thames rather than let it go to [kith]1605-kith or [kin of [Sholto]124-thaddeus sholto or of [Morstan]112-miss morstan]1606-kin of sholto or of morstan . It was not to make [them]1602-three men who are in the andaman convict - barracks and myself rich that [we]1604-us did for [Achmet]176-achmet . [You]1607-you ll find the treasure where the key is , and where [little Tonga]171-tonga is . When [I]195-my companion saw that [your]1607-you launch must catch [us]1604-us , [I]195-my companion put the loot away in a safe place . There are no rupees for [you]1607-you this journey . "[195-my companion]

" [You]1607-you are deceiving [us]1604-us , [Small]1608-small , "[109-jones] said [Athelney Jones]109-jones , sternly . " If [you]1607-you had wished to throw the treasure into [the Thames]17-the thames it would have been easier for [you]1607-you to have thrown box and all . "[109-jones]

" Easier for [me]109-jones to throw , and easier for [you]1607-you to recover , "[109-jones] [he]109-jones answered , with a shrewd , sidelong look . " [The man that was clever enough to hunt [me]109-jones down]1609-the man that was clever enough to hunt me down is clever enough to pick an iron box from [the bottom of [a river]1611-a river]1610-the bottom of a river . Now that they are scattered over five miles or so , it may be a harder job . It went to [my]109-jones heart to do it , though . [I]109-jones was half mad when [you]1607-you came up with [us]1604-us . However , there s no good grieving over it . [I]109-jones ve had ups in [my]109-jones life , and [I]109-jones ve had downs , but [I]109-jones ve learned not to cry over spilled milk . "[109-jones]

" This is a very serious matter , [Small]1612-small , "[400-the detective] said [the detective]400-the detective . " If [you]1607-you had helped justice , instead of thwarting it in this way , [you]1607-you would have had a better chance at [your]1607-you trial . "[400-the detective]

" [Justice]177-justice ! "[684-the ex - convict] snarled [the ex - convict]684-the ex - convict . " [A pretty justice]1613-a pretty justice ! Whose loot is this , if it is not [ours]1604-us ? Where is the justice that [I]685-small should give it up to [those who have never earned it]1614-those who have never earned it ? Look how [I]685-small have earned it ! Twenty long years in [that fever - ridden swamp]1615-that fever - ridden swamp , all day at [work under the mangrove - tree]1616-work under the mangrove - tree , all night chained up in [the filthy convict - huts]1617-the filthy convict - huts , bitten by mosquitoes , racked with ague , bullied by [every cursed black - faced policeman who loved to take it out of [a white man]1168-a white man]1618-every cursed black - faced policeman who loved to take it out of a white man . That was how [I]685-small earned the Agra treasure ; and [you]1607-you talk to [me]685-small of justice because [I]685-small can not bear to feel that [I]685-small have paid this price only that another may enjoy it ! [I]685-small would rather swing a score of times , or have one of Tonga s darts in [my]685-small hide , than live in [[a convict]1098-a convict s cell]1621-a convict s cell and feel that [another man]1578-another man is at [his]1578-another man ease in [a palace with the money that should be [mine]685-small]1623-a palace with the money that should be mine . "[685-small] [Small]685-small had dropped [his]685-small mask of stoicism , and all this came out in a wild whirl of words , while [his]685-small eyes blazed , and the handcuffs clanked together with the impassioned movement of [his]685-small hands . [I]0-i could understand , as [I]0-i saw the fury and the passion of [the man]287-the man , that it was no groundless or unnatural terror which had possessed [Major Sholto]116-major sholto when [he]116-major sholto first learned that [the injured convict]687-the injured convict was upon [his]116-major sholto track .

" [You]287-the man forget that [we]105-holmes know nothing of all this , "[105-holmes] said [Holmes]105-holmes quietly . " [We]105-holmes have not heard [your]287-the man story , and [we]105-holmes can not tell how far justice may originally have been on [your]287-the man side . "[105-holmes]

" Well , [sir]765-sir , [you]765-sir have been very fair - spoken to [me]287-the man , though [I]287-the man can see that [I]287-the man have [you]765-sir to thank that [I]287-the man have these bracelets upon [my]287-the man wrists . Still , [I]287-the man bear no grudge for that . It is all fair and above - board . If [you]765-sir want to hear [my]287-the man story [I]287-the man have no wish to hold it back . What [I]287-the man say to [you]765-sir is [God]139-god s truth , every word of it . Thank [you]765-sir ; [you]765-sir can put the glass beside [me]287-the man here , and [I]287-the man ll put [my]287-the man lips to it if [I]287-the man am dry .[287-the man]

" [I]105-holmes am [a Worcestershire man]1625-a worcestershire man [myself]105-holmes , born near [Pershore]83-pershore . [I]105-holmes dare say [you]765-sir would find a heap of Smalls living [there]784-there now if [you]765-sir were to look . [I]105-holmes have often thought of taking a look round there , but the truth is that [I]105-holmes was never much of a credit to [the family]1627-the family , and [I]105-holmes doubt if [they]1627-the family would be so very glad to see [me]105-holmes . [They]1627-the family were all steady , [chapel - going folk]1628-chapel - going folk , [small farmers]1629-small farmers , well - known and respected over [the country - side]1630-the country - side , while [I]105-holmes was always a bit of [a rover]1631-a rover . At last , however , when [I]105-holmes was about eighteen , [I]105-holmes gave [them]1627-the family no more trouble , for [I]105-holmes got into a mess over [a girl]1632-a girl , and could only get out of it again by taking [the Queen]1091-the queen s shilling and joining [the 3rd Buffs]178-the 3rd buffs , which was just starting for [India]26-india .[105-holmes]

" [I]287-the man wasn t destined to do much soldiering , however . [I]287-the man had just got past the goose - step , and learned to handle [my]287-the man musket , when [I]287-the man was fool enough to go swimming in [the Ganges]84-the ganges . Luckily for [me]287-the man , [[my]287-the man company sergeant]1634-my company sergeant , [John Holder]179-john holder , was in the water at the same time , and [he]179-john holder was [one of [the finest swimmers in the service]1636-the finest swimmers in the service]1635-one of the finest swimmers in the service . [A crocodile]1637-a crocodile took [me]287-the man , just as [I]287-the man was half - way across , and nipped off [my]287-the man right leg as clean as [a surgeon]1638-a surgeon could have done it , just above the knee . What with the shock and the loss of blood , [I]287-the man fainted , and should have drowned if [Holder]179-john holder had not caught hold of [me]287-the man and paddled for [the bank]638-the bank . [I]287-the man was five months in [hospital]1640-hospital over it , and when at last [I]287-the man was able to limp out of it with this timber toe strapped to [my]287-the man stump [I]287-the man found [myself]287-the man invalided out of [the army]1641-the army and unfitted for any active occupation .[287-the man]

" [I]105-holmes was , as [you]1642-you can imagine , pretty down on [my]105-holmes luck at this time , for [I]105-holmes was [a useless cripple]1643-a useless cripple though not yet in [my]105-holmes twentieth year . However , [my]105-holmes misfortune soon proved to be a blessing in disguise . [A man named [Abel White]180-abel white , who had come out [there]784-there as [an indigo - planter]1646-an indigo - planter]1644-a man named abel white , who had come out there as an indigo - planter , wanted [an overseer]1647-an overseer to look after [his]1644-a man named abel white , who had come out there as an indigo - planter coolies and keep [them]1647-an overseer up to [their]1647-an overseer work . [He]1647-an overseer happened to be [a friend of [[our]1649-our colonel]1650-our colonel s , who had taken an interest in [me]105-holmes since the accident]1648-a friend of our colonel s , who had taken an interest in me since the accident . To make a long story short , [the colonel]1651-the colonel recommended [me]105-holmes strongly for the post and , as the work was mostly to be done on horseback , [my]105-holmes leg was no great obstacle , for [I]105-holmes had enough knee left to keep good grip on the saddle . What [I]105-holmes had to do was to ride over [the plantation]1652-the plantation , to keep an eye on [the men]1399-the men as [they]1399-the men worked , and to report [the idlers]1654-the idlers . The pay was fair , [I]105-holmes had comfortable quarters , and altogether [I]105-holmes was content to spend the remainder of [my]105-holmes life in indigo - planting . [Mr. Abel White]180-abel white was [a kind man]1655-a kind man , and [he]180-abel white would often drop into [[my]105-holmes little shanty]1656-my little shanty and smoke a pipe with [me]105-holmes , for [white folk out there]1657-white folk out there feel [their]1657-white folk out there hearts warm to each other as [they]1657-white folk out there never do here at [home]773-home .[105-holmes]

" Well , [I]287-the man was never in luck s way long . Suddenly , without a note of warning , the great mutiny broke upon [us]1659-our . One month [India]26-india lay as still and peaceful , to all appearance , as [Surrey]16-surrey or [Kent]85-kent ; the next there were [two hundred thousand black devils]1660-two hundred thousand black devils let loose , and [the country]269-the country was a perfect hell . Of course [you]1662-you know all about it , [gentlemen]876-gentlemen , a deal more than [I]287-the man do , very like , since reading is not in [my]287-the man line . [I]287-the man only know what [I]287-the man saw with [my]287-the man own eyes . [[Our]1659-our plantation]1664-our plantation was at [a place called [Muttra]86-muttra , near [the border of [the Northwest Provinces]1667-the northwest provinces]1666-the border of the northwest provinces]1665-a place called muttra , near the border of the northwest provinces . Night after night the whole sky was alight with [the burning bungalows]1668-the burning bungalows , and day after day [we]1659-our had [small companies of Europeans passing through [[our]1659-our estate]1670-our estate with [[their]1669-small companies of europeans passing through our estate with their wives and children , on their way to agra , where were the nearest troops wives]1671-their wives and [children]1672-children , on [their]1669-small companies of europeans passing through our estate with their wives and children , on their way to agra , where were the nearest troops way to [Agra]87-agra , where were [the nearest troops]1673-the nearest troops]1669-small companies of europeans passing through our estate with their wives and children , on their way to agra , where were the nearest troops . [Mr. Abel White]180-abel white was [an obstinate man]1674-an obstinate man . [He]180-abel white had it in [his]180-abel white head that the affair had been exaggerated , and that it would blow over as suddenly as it had sprung up . There [he]180-abel white sat on [[his]180-abel white veranda]1675-his veranda , drinking whiskey - pegs and smoking cheroots , while [the country]269-the country was in a blaze about [him]180-abel white . Of course [we]1659-our stuck by [him]180-abel white , [I]287-the man and [Dawson]181-dawson , who , with [[his]181-dawson wife]1677-his wife , used to do the book - work and the managing . Well , one fine day the crash came . [I]287-the man had been away on [a distant plantation]1678-a distant plantation , and was riding slowly [home]773-home in the evening , when [my]287-the man eye fell upon something all huddled together at [the bottom of [a steep nullah]1681-a steep nullah]1680-the bottom of a steep nullah . [I]287-the man rode down to see what it was , and the cold struck through [my]287-the man heart when [I]287-the man found it was [[Dawson]181-dawson s wife]1682-dawson s wife , all cut into ribbons , and half eaten by jackals and native dogs . A little further up [the road]1150-the road [Dawson]181-dawson [himself]181-dawson was lying on [his]181-dawson face , quite dead , with an empty revolver in [his]181-dawson hand and four Sepoys lying across each other in front of [him]181-dawson . [I]287-the man reined up [my]287-the man horse , wondering which way [I]287-the man should turn , but at that moment [I]287-the man saw thick smoke curling up from [[Abel White]180-abel white s bungalow]1684-abel white s bungalow and the flames beginning to burst through the roof . [I]287-the man knew then that [I]287-the man could do [[my]287-the man employer]768-my employer no good , but would only throw [my]287-the man own life away if [I]287-the man meddled in the matter . From where [I]287-the man stood [I]287-the man could see [hundreds of the black fiends]1686-hundreds of the black fiends , with [their]1686-hundreds of the black fiends red coats still on [their]1686-hundreds of the black fiends backs , dancing and howling round [the burning house]1687-the burning house . [Some of [them]1686-hundreds of the black fiends]1688-some of them pointed at [me]287-the man , and a couple of bullets sang past [my]287-the man head ; so [I]287-the man broke away across [the paddy - fields]1689-the paddy - fields , and found [myself]287-the man late at night safe within the walls at [Agra]87-agra .[287-the man]

" As it proved , however , there was no great safety there , either . [The whole country]1690-the whole country was up like a swarm of bees . Wherever [the English]182-the english could collect in little bands [they]182-the english held just the ground that [their]182-the english guns commanded . Everywhere else [they]182-the english were [helpless fugitives]1691-helpless fugitives . It was a fight of [the millions]1692-the millions against [the hundreds]1693-the hundreds ; and the cruellest part of it was that [these men that [we]1695-we fought against]1694-these men that we fought against , foot , horse , and [gunners]1696-gunners , were [[our]1695-we own picked troops , whom [we]1695-we had taught and trained , handling [our]1695-we own weapons , and blowing [our]1695-we own bugle - calls]1697-our own picked troops , whom we had taught and trained , handling our own weapons , and blowing our own bugle - calls . At [Agra]87-agra there were the 3rd [Bengal Fusiliers]88-bengal fusiliers , [some Sikhs]1698-some sikhs , [two troops of horse]1699-two troops of horse , and [a battery of artillery]1700-a battery of artillery . [A volunteer corps of clerks]1701-a volunteer corps of clerks and [merchants]1702-merchants had been formed , and this [I]105-holmes joined , wooden leg and all . [We]1695-we went out to meet [the rebels]1703-the rebels at [Shahgunge]89-shahgunge early in July , and [we]1695-we beat [them]1703-the rebels back for a time , but [our]1695-we powder gave out , and [we]1695-we had to fall back upon [the city]579-the city .[105-holmes]

" Nothing but the worst news came to [us]1695-we from every side , which is not to be wondered at , for if [you]1705-you look at the map [you]1705-you will see that [we]1695-we were right in [the heart of it]1706-the heart of it . [Lucknow]90-lucknow is rather better than a hundred miles to the east , and [Cawnpore]91-cawnpore about as far to the south . From every point on the compass there was nothing but torture and murder and outrage .[287-the man]

" [The city of [Agra]87-agra]1707-the city of agra is [a great place]1708-a great place , swarming with [fanatics]1709-fanatics and [fierce devil - worshippers of all sorts]1710-fierce devil - worshippers of all sorts . [[Our]1695-we handful of [men]912-men]1711-our handful of men were lost among [the narrow , winding streets]1713-the narrow , winding streets . [[Our]1695-we leader]1714-our leader moved across [the river]869-the river , therefore , and took up [his]1714-our leader position in [the old fort at [Agra]87-agra]1716-the old fort at agra . [I]105-holmes don t know if [any of [you]1718-you gentlemen]1717-any of you gentlemen have ever read or heard anything of [that old fort]1719-that old fort . It is a very queer place , the queerest that ever [I]105-holmes was in , and [I]105-holmes have been in some rum corners , too . First of all , [it]1719-that old fort is enormous in size . [I]105-holmes should think that the enclosure must be acres and [acres]1720-acres . There is a modern part , which took all [[our]1695-we garrison]1721-our garrison , [women]407-women , [children]1672-children , [stores]1724-stores , and everything else , with plenty of room over . But the modern part is nothing like the size of [the old quarter]1725-the old quarter , where [nobody]1726-nobody goes , and which is given over to the scorpions and the centipedes . [It]1719-that old fort is all full of [great deserted halls]1727-great deserted halls , and [winding passages]1728-winding passages , and [long corridors]1729-long corridors twisting in and out , so that it is easy enough for [folk]981-folk to get lost in [it]1719-that old fort . For this reason it was seldom that [any one]1731-any one went into [it]1719-that old fort , though now and again [a party with torches]1732-a party with torches might go exploring .[105-holmes]

" [The river]869-the river washes along the front of [the old fort]1734-the old fort , and so protects [it]1734-the old fort , but on the sides and behind there are many doors , and these had to be guarded , of course , in [the old quarter]1725-the old quarter as well as in that which was actually held by [[our]1695-we troops]1736-our troops . [We]1695-we were short - handed , with [hardly men]1737-hardly men enough to man the angles of [the building]968-the building and to serve the guns . It was impossible for [us]1695-we , therefore , to station [a strong guard]1739-a strong guard at every one of the innumerable gates . What [we]1695-we did was to organise [a central guard - house in the middle of [the fort]1741-the fort]1740-a central guard - house in the middle of the fort , and to leave each gate under the charge of [one white man]1171-one white man and [two or three natives]1743-two or three natives . [I]287-the man was selected to take charge during certain hours of the night of a small isolated door upon [the southwest side of [the building]968-the building]1744-the southwest side of the building . [Two Sikh troopers]1746-two sikh troopers were placed under [my]287-the man command , and [I]287-the man was instructed if anything went wrong to fire [my]287-the man musket , when [I]287-the man might rely upon help coming at once from the central guard . As [the guard]1747-the guard was a good two hundred paces away , however , and as [the space between]1748-the space between was cut up into [a labyrinth of passages and corridors]1749-a labyrinth of passages and corridors , [I]287-the man had great doubts as to whether [they]1746-two sikh troopers could arrive in time to be of any use in case of an actual attack .[287-the man]

" Well , [I]105-holmes was pretty proud at having this small command given [me]105-holmes , since [I]105-holmes was [a raw recruit]1750-a raw recruit , and [a game - legged one]1751-a game - legged one at that . For two nights [I]105-holmes kept the watch with [[my]105-holmes Punjaubees]1752-my punjaubees . [They]1752-my punjaubees were tall , fierce - looking chaps , [Mahomet Singh]119-mahomet singh and [Abdullah Khan]120-abdullah khan by name , [both old fighting - men who had borne arms against [us]1754-us at [Chilian - wallah]92-chilian - wallah]1753-both old fighting - men who had borne arms against us at chilian - wallah . [They]1752-my punjaubees could talk English pretty well , but [I]105-holmes could get little out of [them]1752-my punjaubees . [They]1752-my punjaubees preferred to stand together and jabber all night in [their]1752-my punjaubees queer Sikh lingo . For [myself]105-holmes , [I]105-holmes used to stand outside the gateway , looking down on [the broad , winding river]1755-the broad , winding river and on the twinkling lights of [the great city]237-the great city . The beating of drums , the rattle of tomtoms , and the yells and howls of [the rebels , drunk with opium and with bang]1757-the rebels , drunk with opium and with bang , were enough to remind [us]1754-us all night of [[our]1754-us dangerous neighbours]1758-our dangerous neighbours across [the stream]1281-the stream . Every two hours [the officer of the night]1760-the officer of the night used to come round to all the posts , to make sure that all was well .[105-holmes]

" The third night of [my]287-the man watch was dark and dirty , with a small , driving rain . It was dreary work standing in the gateway hour after hour in such weather . [I]287-the man tried again and again to make [my]287-the man Sikhs talk , but without much success . At two in the morning the rounds passed , and broke for a moment the weariness of the night . Finding that [[my]287-the man companions]1761-my companions would not be led into conversation , [I]287-the man took out [my]287-the man pipe , and laid down [my]287-the man musket to strike the match . In an instant [the two Sikhs]1762-the two sikhs were upon [me]287-the man . [One of [them]1762-the two sikhs]918-one of them snatched [my]287-the man firelock up and levelled it at [my]287-the man head , while [the other]1575-the other held a great knife to [my]287-the man throat and swore between [his]1575-the other teeth that [he]1575-the other would plunge it into [me]287-the man if [I]287-the man moved a step .[287-the man]

" [My]105-holmes first thought was that [these fellows]1152-these fellows were in league with [the rebels]1703-the rebels , and that this was the beginning of an assault . If [our]1767-our door were in the hands of [the Sepoys]183-the sepoys [the place]1134-the place must fall , and [the women]1769-the women and [children]1672-children be treated as [they]1762-the two sikhs were in [Cawnpore]91-cawnpore . Maybe [you]1771-you gentlemen think that [I]105-holmes am just making out a case for [myself]105-holmes , but [I]105-holmes give [you]1771-you [my]105-holmes word that when [I]105-holmes thought of that , though [I]105-holmes felt the point of the knife at [my]105-holmes throat , [I]105-holmes opened [my]105-holmes mouth with the intention of giving a scream , if it was [my]105-holmes last one , which might alarm [the main guard]1772-the main guard . [The man who held [me]105-holmes]1773-the man who held me seemed to know [my]105-holmes thoughts ; for , even as [I]105-holmes braced [myself]105-holmes to it , [he]1773-the man who held me whispered , Don t make a noise . [The fort]1741-the fort is safe enough . There are no rebel dogs on [this side of [the river]869-the river]1775-this side of the river . There was the ring of truth in what [he]1773-the man who held me said , and [I]105-holmes knew that if [I]105-holmes raised [my]105-holmes voice [I]105-holmes was [a dead man]1777-a dead man . [I]105-holmes could read it in [the fellow]1145-the fellow s brown eyes . [I]105-holmes waited , therefore , in silence , to see what it was that [they]1145-the fellow wanted from [me]105-holmes .[105-holmes]

" Listen to [me]287-the man , [Sahib]122-sahib , said [the taller and fiercer of [the pair]1780-the pair]1779-the taller and fiercer of the pair , [the one whom [they]1145-the fellow called [Abdullah Khan]120-abdullah khan]1781-the one whom they called abdullah khan . [You]122-sahib must either be with [us]1145-the fellow now or [you]122-sahib must be silenced forever . The thing is too great a one for [us]1145-the fellow to hesitate . Either [you]122-sahib are heart and soul with [us]1145-the fellow on [your]122-sahib oath on the cross of [the Christians]184-the christians , or [your]122-sahib body this night shall be thrown into the ditch and [we]1145-the fellow shall pass over to [[our]1145-the fellow brothers]1782-our brothers in [the rebel army]1783-the rebel army . There is no middle way . Which is it to be , death or life ? [We]1145-the fellow can only give [you]122-sahib three minutes to decide , for the time is passing , and all must be done before the rounds come again .[287-the man]

" How can [I]105-holmes decide ? said I. [You]122-sahib have not told [me]105-holmes what [you]122-sahib want of [me]105-holmes . But [I]105-holmes tell [you]122-sahib now that if it is anything against the safety of [the fort]1741-the fort [I]105-holmes will have [no truck with [it]1741-the fort]1785-no truck with it , so [you]122-sahib can drive [home]773-home [your]122-sahib knife and welcome .[105-holmes]

" It is nothing against [the fort]1741-the fort , said [he]105-holmes . [We]1145-the fellow only ask [you]122-sahib to do that which [[your]122-sahib countrymen]1788-your countrymen come to [this land]1789-this land for . [We]1145-the fellow ask [you]122-sahib to be rich . If [you]122-sahib will be one of [us]1145-the fellow this night , [we]1145-the fellow will swear to [you]122-sahib upon the naked knife , and by the threefold oath which [no Sikh]1790-no sikh was ever known to break , that [you]122-sahib shall have [your]122-sahib fair share of the loot . A quarter of the treasure shall be [yours]122-sahib . [We]1145-the fellow can say no fairer .[287-the man]

" But what is the treasure , then ? [I]105-holmes asked . [I]105-holmes am as ready to be rich as [you]122-sahib can be , if [you]122-sahib will but show [me]105-holmes how it can be done .[105-holmes]

" [You]105-holmes will swear , then , said [he]122-sahib , by the bones of [[your]122-sahib father]740-your father , by the honour of [[your]122-sahib mother]1792-your mother , by the cross of [your]122-sahib faith , to raise no hand and speak no word against [us]1145-the fellow , either now or afterwards ?[287-the man]

" [I]105-holmes will swear it , [I]105-holmes answered , provided that [the fort]1741-the fort is not endangered .[105-holmes]

" Then [[my]287-the man comrade]1794-my comrade and [I]287-the man will swear that [you]122-sahib shall have a quarter of the treasure which shall be equally divided among the four of [us]1145-the fellow .[287-the man]

" There are but three , said [I.]105-holmes[105-holmes]

" No ; [Dost Akbar]121-dost akbar must have [his]121-dost akbar share . [We]1145-the fellow can tell the tale to [you]122-sahib while [we]1145-the fellow await [them]1795-their . Do [you]122-sahib stand at the gate , [Mahomet Singh]119-mahomet singh , and give notice of [their]1795-their coming . The thing stands thus , [Sahib]122-sahib , and [I]287-the man tell it to [you]122-sahib because [I]287-the man know that an oath is binding upon [a Feringhee]185-a feringhee , and that [we]1145-the fellow may trust [you]122-sahib . Had [you]122-sahib been [a lying Hindoo]1796-a lying hindoo , though [you]122-sahib had sworn by all the gods in [their]1795-their false temples , [your]122-sahib blood would have been upon the knife , and [your]122-sahib body in the water . But [the Sikh]186-the sikh knows [the Englishman]187-the englishman , and [the Englishman]1797-the englishman knows [the Sikh]186-the sikh . Hearken , then , to what [I]287-the man have to say .[287-the man]

" There is [a rajah in [the northern provinces]1799-the northern provinces who has much wealth , though [[his]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small lands]1800-his lands are small]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small . Much has come to [him]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small from [[his]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small father]1306-his father , and more still [he]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small has set by [himself]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small , for [he]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small is of a low nature and hoards [his]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small gold rather than spend it . When the troubles broke out [he]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small would be [friends]956-friends both with the lion and the tiger , with [the Sepoy]1803-the sepoy and with [the Company s [Raj]188-raj]1804-the company s raj .
