Soon , however , it seemed to [him]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small that [the white men]1805-the white men s day was come , for through all [the land]1483-the land [he]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small could hear of nothing but of [their]1805-the white men death and [their]1805-the white men overthrow . Yet , being [a careful man]1807-a careful man , [he]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small made such plans that , come what might , half at least of [his]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small treasure should be left to [him]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small . That which was in gold and silver [he]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small kept by [him]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small in [the vaults of [[his]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small palace]1809-his palace]1808-the vaults of his palace , but the most precious stones and the choicest pearls that [he]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small had [he]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small put in an iron box , and sent it by [a trusty servant who , under the guise of [a merchant]1811-a merchant]1810-a trusty servant who , under the guise of a merchant , should take it to [the fort at [Agra]87-agra]1812-the fort at agra , there to lie until [the land]1483-the land is at peace . Thus , if [the rebels]1703-the rebels won [he]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small would have [his]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small money , but if [the Company]1815-the company conquered [his]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small jewels would be saved to [him]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small . Having thus divided [his]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small hoard , [he]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small threw [himself]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small into the cause of [the Sepoys]183-the sepoys , since [they]183-the sepoys were strong upon [[his]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small borders]1816-his borders . By doing this , mark [you]1817-you , [Sahib]122-sahib , [his]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small property becomes the due of [those who have been true to [their]1818-those who have been true to their salt salt]1818-those who have been true to their salt .[105-holmes]

" [This pretended merchant]1819-this pretended merchant , who travels under the name of [Achmet]176-achmet , is now in [the city of]1820-the city of [Agra]87-agra , and desires to gain [his]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small way into [the fort]1741-the fort . [He]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small has with [him]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small as [travelling - companion [[my]287-the man foster - brother]1823-my foster - brother [Dost Akbar]121-dost akbar , who knows [his]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small secret]1822-travelling - companion my foster - brother dost akbar , who knows his secret . [Dost Akbar]121-dost akbar has promised this night to lead [him]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small to [a side - postern of [the fort]1741-the fort]1824-a side - postern of the fort , and has chosen this one for [his]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small purpose . Here [he]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small will come presently , and here [he]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small will find [Mahomet Singh]119-mahomet singh and [myself]287-the man awaiting [him]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small . [The place]1134-the place is lonely , and [none]1827-none shall know of [his]1798-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small coming . [The world]706-the world shall know of [the merchant]1829-the merchant [Achmet]176-achmet no more , but the great treasure of [the rajah]1830-the rajah shall be divided among [us]1831-us . What say [you]287-the man to it , [Sahib]122-sahib ?[287-the man]

" In Worcestershire the life of [a man]736-a man seems a great and a sacred thing ; but it is very different when there is fire and blood all round [you]287-the man and [you]287-the man have been used to meeting death at every turn . Whether [Achmet]176-achmet [the merchant]1829-the merchant lived or died was a thing as light as air to [me]105-holmes , but at the talk about the treasure [my]105-holmes heart turned to it , and [I]105-holmes thought of what [I]105-holmes might do in [the old country]1834-the old country with it , and how [[my]105-holmes folk]1835-my folk would stare when [they]1835-my folk saw [their]1835-my folk ne er - do - well coming back with [his]176-achmet pockets full of gold moidores . [I]105-holmes had , therefore , already made up [my]105-holmes mind . [Abdullah Khan]120-abdullah khan , however , thinking that [I]105-holmes hesitated , pressed the matter more closely .[105-holmes]

" Consider , [Sahib]122-sahib , said [he]120-abdullah khan , that if [this man]1836-this man is taken by [the commandant]1837-the commandant [he]1836-this man will be hung or shot , and [his]1836-this man jewels taken by [the government]1838-the government , so that [no man]1839-no man will be a rupee the better for [them]1840-them . Now , since [we]1841-we do the taking of [him]1836-this man , why should [we]1841-we not do the rest as well ? The jewels will be as well with [us]1841-we as in [[the Company]1815-the company s coffers]1843-the company s coffers . There will be enough to make every one of [us]1841-we [rich men]1844-rich men and [great chiefs]1845-great chiefs . [No one]730-no one can know about the matter , for here [we]1841-we are cut off from [all men]1847-all men . What could be better for the purpose ? Say again , then , [Sahib]122-sahib , whether [you]122-sahib are with [us]1841-we , or if [we]1841-we must look upon [you]122-sahib as [an enemy]1848-an enemy .[287-the man]

" [I]105-holmes am with [you]122-sahib heart and soul , said [I.]105-holmes[105-holmes]

" It is well , [he]122-sahib answered , handing [me]287-the man back [my]287-the man firelock . [You]122-sahib see that [we]1841-we trust [you]122-sahib , for [your]122-sahib word , like [ours]1841-we , is not to be broken . [We]1841-we have now only to wait for [[my]287-the man brother]924-my brother and [the merchant]1829-the merchant .[287-the man]

" Does [[your]122-sahib brother]750-your brother know , then , of what [you]122-sahib will do ? [I]105-holmes asked .[105-holmes]

" The plan is [his]750-your brother . [He]750-your brother has devised it . [We]1841-we will go to the gate and share the watch with [Mahomet Singh]119-mahomet singh .[287-the man]

" The rain was still falling steadily , for it was just the beginning of the wet season . Brown , heavy clouds were drifting across the sky , and it was hard to see more than a stone - cast . [A deep moat]1852-a deep moat lay in front of [our]1841-we door , but the water was in places nearly dried up , and it could easily be crossed . It was strange to [me]105-holmes to be standing there with [those two wild Punjaubees waiting for [the man who was coming to [his]1854-the man who was coming to his death death]1854-the man who was coming to his death]1853-those two wild punjaubees waiting for the man who was coming to his death .[105-holmes]

" Suddenly [my]287-the man eye caught the glint of a shaded lantern at the other side of [the moat]1855-the moat . It vanished among the mound - heaps , and then appeared again coming slowly in [our]1841-we direction .[287-the man]

" Here [they]1853-those two wild punjaubees waiting for the man who was coming to his death are ! [I]105-holmes exclaimed .[105-holmes]

" [You]122-sahib will challenge [him]1854-the man who was coming to his death , [Sahib]122-sahib , as usual , whispered [Abdullah]120-abdullah khan . Give [him]1854-the man who was coming to his death no cause for fear . Send [us]1841-we in with [him]1854-the man who was coming to his death , and [we]1841-we shall do the rest while [you]122-sahib stay here on guard . Have the lantern ready to uncover , that [we]1841-we may be sure that it is indeed [the man]287-the man .[287-the man]

" The light had flickered onwards , now stopping and now advancing , until [I]105-holmes could see [two dark figures]1857-two dark figures upon the other side of [the moat]1855-the moat . [I]105-holmes let [them]1857-two dark figures scramble down [the sloping bank]1859-the sloping bank , splash through [the mire]1860-the mire , and climb half - way up to the gate , before [I]105-holmes challenged [them]1857-two dark figures .[105-holmes]

" Who goes [there]784-there ? said [I]287-the man , in a subdued voice .[287-the man]

" [Friends]956-friends , came the answer . [I]105-holmes uncovered [my]105-holmes lantern and threw a flood of light upon [them]1857-two dark figures . [The first]1863-the first was [an enormous Sikh]1864-an enormous sikh , with a black beard which swept nearly down to [his]1863-the first cummerbund . Outside of a show [I]105-holmes have never seen so tall [a man]736-a man . [The other]1575-the other was [a little , fat , round fellow]1867-a little , fat , round fellow , with a great yellow turban , and a bundle in [his]1575-the other hand , done up in a shawl . [He]1575-the other seemed to be all in a quiver with fear , for [his]1575-the other hands twitched as if [he]1575-the other had the ague , and [his]1575-the other head kept turning to left and right with two bright little twinkling eyes , like a mouse when [he]1575-the other ventures out from [his]1575-the other hole . It gave [me]105-holmes the chills to think of killing [him]1575-the other , but [I]105-holmes thought of the treasure , and [my]105-holmes heart set as hard as a flint within [me]105-holmes . When [he]1575-the other saw [my]105-holmes white face [he]1575-the other gave a little chirrup of joy and came running up towards [me]105-holmes .[105-holmes]

" [Your]105-holmes protection , [Sahib]122-sahib , [he]1575-the other panted , [your]105-holmes protection for [the unhappy merchant Achmet]1868-the unhappy merchant achmet . [I]287-the man have travelled across [Rajpootana]93-rajpootana that [I]287-the man might seek [the shelter of [the fort at [Agra]87-agra]1812-the fort at agra]1869-the shelter of the fort at agra . [I]287-the man have been robbed and beaten and abused because [I]287-the man have been [the friend of [the Company]1815-the company]1871-the friend of the company . It is a blessed night this when [I]287-the man am once more in safety , [I]287-the man and [my]287-the man poor possessions .[287-the man]

" What have [you]1575-the other in the bundle ? [I]105-holmes asked .[105-holmes]

" An iron box , [he]1575-the other answered , which contains one or two little family matters which are of no value to [others]1873-others , but which [I]287-the man should be sorry to lose . Yet [I]287-the man am not [a beggar]1874-a beggar ; and [I]287-the man shall reward [you]1575-the other , [young Sahib]122-sahib , and [[your]1575-the other governor]1875-your governor also , if [he]1875-your governor will give [me]287-the man the shelter [I]287-the man ask .[287-the man]

" [I]105-holmes could not trust [myself]105-holmes to speak longer with [the man]287-the man . The more [I]105-holmes looked at [his]287-the man fat , frightened face , the harder did it seem that [we]1877-we should slay [him]287-the man in cold blood . It was best to get it over .[105-holmes]

" Take [him]287-the man to the main guard "[287-the man] , said I. The two Sikhs closed in upon [him]688-him on each side , and [the giant]689-the giant walked behind , while [they]690-they marched in through [the dark gateway]691-the dark gateway . Never was [a man so compassed round with death]692-a man so compassed round with death . [I]0-i remained at the gateway with the lantern .

" [I]0-i could hear the measured tramp of [their]690-they footsteps sounding through [the lonely corridors]1878-the lonely corridors . Suddenly it ceased , and [I]0-i heard voices , and a scuffle , with the sound of blows . A moment later there came , to [my]0-i horror , a rush of footsteps coming in [my]0-i direction , with the loud breathing of [a running man]1879-a running man . [I]0-i turned [my]0-i lantern down [the long , straight passage]1880-the long , straight passage , and there was [the fat man , running like the wind]1881-the fat man , running like the wind , with a smear of blood across [his]287-the man face , and close at [his]287-the man heels , bounding like a tiger , [the great black - bearded Sikh , with a knife flashing in [his]287-the man hand]1882-the great black - bearded sikh , with a knife flashing in his hand . [I]0-i have never seen [a man]736-a man run so fast as [that little merchant]1884-that little merchant . [He]287-the man was gaining on [the Sikh]186-the sikh , and [I]0-i could see that if [he]287-the man once passed [me]0-i and got to the open air [he]287-the man would save [himself]287-the man yet . [My]0-i heart softened to [him]287-the man , but again the thought of [his]287-the man treasure turned [me]0-i hard and bitter . [I]0-i cast [my]0-i firelock between [his]287-the man legs as [he]287-the man raced past , and [he]287-the man rolled twice over like a shot rabbit . Ere [he]287-the man could stagger to [his]287-the man feet [the Sikh]1885-the sikh was upon [him]287-the man , and buried [his]1885-the sikh knife twice in [his]1885-the sikh side . [The man]287-the man never uttered moan nor moved muscle , but lay were [he]287-the man had fallen . [I]0-i think [myself]0-i that [he]287-the man may have broken [his]287-the man neck with the fall . [You]1887-you see , [gentlemen]876-gentlemen , that [I]0-i am keeping [my]0-i promise . [I]0-i am telling [you]1887-you every work of the business just exactly as it happened , whether it is in [my]0-i favour or not . "[0-i]

[He]693-i stopped , and held out [his]693-i manacled hands for the whiskey - and - water which [Holmes]105-holmes had brewed for [him]693-i . For [myself]0-i , [I]0-i confess that [I]0-i had now conceived the utmost horror of [the man]287-the man , not only for this cold - blooded business in which [he]287-the man had been concerned , but even more for the somewhat flippant and careless way in which [he]287-the man narrated it . Whatever punishment was in store for [him]287-the man , [I]0-i felt that [he]287-the man might expect no sympathy from [me]0-i . [Sherlock Holmes]105-holmes and [Jones]109-jones sat with [their]695-their hands upon [their]695-their knees , deeply interested in the story , but with the same disgust written upon [their]695-their faces . [He]693-i may have observed it , for there was a touch of defiance in [his]693-i voice and manner as [he]693-i proceeded .

" It was all very bad , no doubt , "[693-i] said [he]693-i . " [I]693-i should like to know how [many fellows in [my]693-i shoes]1889-many fellows in my shoes would have refused a share of this loot when [they]1889-many fellows in my shoes knew that [they]1889-many fellows in my shoes would have [their]1889-many fellows in my shoes throats cut for [their]1889-many fellows in my shoes pains . Besides , it was [my]693-i life or [his]693-i when once [he]693-i was in [the fort]1741-the fort . If [he]693-i had got out , the whole business would come to light , and [I]693-i should have been court - martialled and shot as likely as not ; for [people]1495-people were not very lenient at a time like that . "[693-i]

" Go on with [your]693-i story , "[105-holmes] said [Holmes]105-holmes , shortly .

" Well , [we]1892-we carried [him]693-i in , [Abdullah]120-abdullah khan , [Akbar]121-dost akbar , and [I.]693-i A fine weight [he]693-i was , too , for all that [he]693-i was so short . [Mahomet Singh]119-mahomet singh was left to guard the door . [We]1892-we took [him]693-i to [a place which [the Sikhs]1894-the sikhs had already prepared]1893-a place which the sikhs had already prepared . [It]1893-a place which the sikhs had already prepared was some distance off , where [a winding passage]1895-a winding passage leads to [a great empty hall]1896-a great empty hall , the brick walls of which were all crumbling to pieces . The earth floor had sunk in at one place , making [a natural grave]1897-a natural grave , so [we]1892-we left [Achmet]176-achmet [the merchant]1829-the merchant there , having first covered [him]693-i over with loose bricks . This done , [we]1892-we all went back to the treasure .[693-i]

" It lay where [he]693-i had dropped it when [he]693-i was first attacked . The box was the same which now lies open upon [your]1899-your table . A key was hung by a silken cord to that carved handle upon the top . [We]1892-we opened it , and the light of the lantern gleamed upon a collection of gems such as [I]693-i have read of and thought about when [I]693-i was [a little lad]1900-a little lad at [Pershore]83-pershore . It was blinding to look upon them . When [we]1892-we had feasted [our]1892-we eyes [we]1892-we took them all out and made a list of them . There were one hundred and forty - three diamonds of the first water , including one which has been called , [I]693-i believe , the Great Mogul and is said to be the second largest stone in existence . Then there were ninety - seven very fine emeralds , and one hundred and seventy rubies , some of which , however , were small . There were forty carbuncles , two hundred and ten sapphires , sixty - one agates , and a great quantity of beryls , onyxes , cats -eyes , turquoises , and other stones , the very names of which [I]693-i did not know at the time , though [I]693-i have become more familiar with them since . Besides this , there were nearly three hundred very fine pearls , twelve of which were set in a gold coronet . By the way , these last had been taken out of the chest and were not there when [I]693-i recovered it .[693-i]

" After [we]1892-we had counted [our]1892-we treasures [we]1892-we put them back into the chest and carried them to the gateway to show [them]1901-them to [Mahomet Singh]119-mahomet singh . Then [we]1892-we solemnly renewed [our]1892-we oath to stand by [each other]902-each other and be true to [our]1892-we secret . [We]1892-we agreed to conceal [our]1892-we loot in a safe place until [the country]269-the country should be at peace again , and then to divide it equally among [ourselves]1892-we . There was no use dividing it at present , for if gems of such value were found upon [us]1892-we it would cause suspicion , and there was no privacy in [the fort]1741-the fort nor any place where [we]1892-we could keep [them]1901-them . [We]1892-we carried the box , therefore , into [the same hall]1905-the same hall where [we]1892-we had buried the body , and there , under certain bricks in the best - preserved wall , [we]1892-we made a hollow and put [our]1892-we treasure . [We]1892-we made careful note of [the place]1134-the place , and next day [I]693-i drew four plans , one for each of [us]1892-we , and put the sign of the four of [us]1892-we at the bottom , for [we]1892-we had sworn that [we]1892-we should each always act for all , so that none might take advantage . That is an oath that [I]693-i can put [my]693-i hand to [my]693-i heart and swear that [I]693-i have never broken .[693-i]

" Well , there s no use [my]693-i telling [you]1907-you gentlemen what came of the Indian mutiny . After [Wilson]189-wilson took [Delhi]94-delhi and [Sir Colin relieved Lucknow]190-sir colin relieved lucknow the back of the business was broken . [Fresh troops]1908-fresh troops came pouring in , and [Nana Sahib]122-sahib made [himself]122-sahib scarce over [the frontier]1909-the frontier . A flying column under [Colonel Greathed]191-colonel greathed came round to [Agra]87-agra and cleared [the Pandies]192-the pandies away from [it]87-agra . Peace seemed to be settling upon [the country]269-the country , and [[we]1892-we four]1911-we four were beginning to hope that the time was at hand when [we]1892-we might safely go off with [our]1892-we shares of the plunder . In a moment , however , [our]1892-we hopes were shattered by [our]1892-we being arrested as [the murderers of [Achmet]176-achmet]1912-the murderers of achmet .[693-i]

" It came about in this way . When [the rajah]1830-the rajah put [his]1830-the rajah jewels into the hands of [Achmet]176-achmet [he]1830-the rajah did it because [he]1830-the rajah knew that [he]1830-the rajah was [a trusty man]1914-a trusty man . [They]1915-they are [suspicious folk in [the East]95-the east]1916-suspicious folk in the east , however : so what does [this rajah]1917-this rajah do but take [a second even more trusty servant]1918-a second even more trusty servant and set [him]1918-a second even more trusty servant to play [the spy upon the first]1919-the spy upon the first ? [This second man]1920-this second man was ordered never to let [Achmet]176-achmet out of [his]1920-this second man sight , and [he]1920-this second man followed [him]1920-this second man like [his]1920-this second man shadow . [He]1920-this second man went after [him]1920-this second man that night and saw [him]1920-this second man pass through the doorway . Of course [he]1920-this second man thought [he]1920-this second man had taken refuge in [the fort]1741-the fort , and applied for admission [there]784-there [himself]1920-this second man next day , but could find no trace of [Achmet]176-achmet . This seemed to [him]1920-this second man so strange that [he]1920-this second man spoke about it to [a sergeant of guides]1923-a sergeant of guides , who brought it to the ears of [the commandant]1837-the commandant . A thorough search was quickly made , and the body was discovered . Thus at the very moment that [we]1925-we thought that all was safe [we]1925-we were all four seized and brought to trial on a charge of murder , three of [us]1925-we because [we]1925-we had held the gate that night , and the fourth because [he]1926-he was known to have been in the company of [the murdered man]1927-the murdered man . Not a word about the jewels came out at the trial , for [the rajah]1830-the rajah had been deposed and driven out of [India]26-india : so [no one]730-no one had any particular interest in [them]1930-them . The murder , however , was clearly made out , and it was certain that [we]1925-we must all have been concerned in it . [The three Sikhs]1931-the three sikhs got penal servitude for life , and [I]693-i was condemned to death , though [my]693-i sentence was afterwards commuted into the same as the others .[693-i]

" It was rather a queer position that [we]1925-we found [ourselves]1925-we in then . There [we]1925-we were all four tied by the leg and with precious little chance of ever getting out again , while [we]1925-we each held a secret which might have put each of [us]1925-we in [a palace]1932-a palace if [we]1925-we could only have made use of it . It was enough to make [a man]736-a man eat [his]736-a man heart out to have to stand the kick and the cuff of [every petty jack - in - office]1934-every petty jack - in - office , to have rice to eat and water to drink , when that gorgeous fortune was ready for [him]736-a man outside , just waiting to be picked up . It might have driven [me]693-i mad ; but [I]693-i was always [a pretty stubborn one]1935-a pretty stubborn one , so [I]693-i just held on and bided [my]693-i time .[693-i]

" At last it seemed to [me]693-i to have come . [I]693-i was changed from [Agra]87-agra to [Madras]96-madras , and from there to [Blair Island]97-blair island in [the Andamans]62-the andamans . There are [very few white convicts]1936-very few white convicts at [this settlement]1937-this settlement , and , as [I]693-i had behaved well from the first , [I]693-i soon found [myself]693-i [a sort of privileged person]1938-a sort of privileged person . [I]693-i was given a hut in [Hope Town]98-hope town , which is [a small place on [the slopes of [Mount Harriet]99-mount harriet]1940-the slopes of mount harriet]1939-a small place on the slopes of mount harriet , and [I]693-i was left pretty much to [myself]693-i . [It]1939-a small place on the slopes of mount harriet is [a dreary , fever - stricken place]1941-a dreary , fever - stricken place , and all beyond [[our]1942-us little clearings]1943-our little clearings was infested with [wild cannibal natives]1944-wild cannibal natives , who were ready enough to blow a poisoned dart at [us]1942-us if [they]1944-wild cannibal natives saw a chance . There was digging , and ditching , and yam - planting , and a dozen other things to be done , so [we]1942-us were busy enough all day ; though in the evening [we]1942-us had a little time to [ourselves]1942-us . Among other things , [I]693-i learned to dispense drugs for [the surgeon]1945-the surgeon , and picked up a smattering of [his]1945-the surgeon knowledge . All the time [I]693-i was on the lookout for a chance of escape ; but it is hundreds of miles from [any other land]1946-any other land , and there is little or no wind in [those seas]1947-those seas : so it was a terribly difficult job to get away .[693-i]

" [The surgeon]1945-the surgeon , [Dr. Somerton]193-dr. somerton , was [a fast , sporting young chap]1949-a fast , sporting young chap , and [the other young officers]1950-the other young officers would meet in [[his]1945-the surgeon rooms]1951-his rooms of an evening and play cards . [The surgery]1952-the surgery , where [I]693-i used to make up [my]693-i drugs , was next to [[his]1945-the surgeon sitting - room]1953-his sitting - room , with a small window between [us]1942-us . Often , if [I]693-i felt lonesome , [I]693-i used to turn out the lamp in [the surgery]1952-the surgery , and then , standing there , [I]693-i could hear [their]1950-the other young officers talk and watch [their]1950-the other young officers play . [I]693-i am fond of a hand at cards [myself]693-i , and it was almost as good as having one to watch the others . There was [Major Sholto]116-major sholto , [Captain Morstan]115-captain morstan , and [Lieutenant Bromley Brown]194-lieutenant bromley brown , who were in command of [the native troops]1955-the native troops , and there was [the surgeon]1945-the surgeon [himself]1945-the surgeon , and [two or three prison - officials]1957-two or three prison - officials , crafty old hands who played a nice sly safe game . A very snug little party [they]1950-the other young officers used to make .[693-i]

" Well , there was one thing which very soon struck [me]693-i , and that was that [the soldiers]1958-the soldiers used always to lose and [the civilians]1959-the civilians to win . Mind , [I]693-i don t say that there was anything unfair , but so it was . [These prison - chaps]1960-these prison - chaps had done little else than play cards ever since [they]1960-these prison - chaps had been at [the Andamans]62-the andamans , and [they]1960-these prison - chaps knew [each other]902-each other s game to a point , while [the others]973-the others just played to pass the time and threw [their]973-the others cards down anyhow . Night after night [the soldiers]1958-the soldiers got up [poorer men]1964-poorer men , and the poorer [they]1958-the soldiers got the more keen [they]1958-the soldiers were to play . [Major Sholto]116-major sholto was the hardest hit . [He]116-major sholto used to pay in notes and gold at first , but soon it came to notes of hand and for big sums . [He]116-major sholto sometimes would win for a few deals , just to give [him]116-major sholto heart , and then the luck would set in against [him]116-major sholto worse than ever . All day [he]116-major sholto would wander about as black as thunder , and [he]116-major sholto took to drinking a deal more than was good for [him]116-major sholto .[693-i]

" One night [he]116-major sholto lost even more heavily than usual . [I]693-i was sitting in [[my]693-i hut]1965-my hut when [he]116-major sholto and [Captain Morstan]115-captain morstan came stumbling along on the way to [[their]1966-they quarters]1967-their quarters . [They]1966-they were [bosom friends]1968-bosom friends , [those two]1969-those two , and never far apart . [The major]800-the major was raving about [his]800-the major losses .[693-i]

" It s all up , [Morstan]115-captain morstan , [he]800-the major was saying , as [they]1966-they passed [[my]693-i hut]1965-my hut . [I]693-i shall have to send in [my]693-i papers . [I]693-i am [a ruined man]1972-a ruined man .[693-i]

" Nonsense , [old chap]1973-old chap ! said [the other]1575-the other , slapping [him]116-major sholto upon the shoulder . [I]693-i ve had a nasty facer [myself]693-i , but That was all [I]693-i could hear , but it was enough to set [me]693-i thinking .[693-i]

" A couple of days later [Major Sholto]116-major sholto was strolling on [the beach]1975-the beach : so [I]693-i took the chance of speaking to [him]116-major sholto .[693-i]

" [I]693-i wish to have [your]116-major sholto advice , [major]1976-major , said [I.]693-i[693-i]

" Well , [Small]1977-small , what is it ? [he]116-major sholto asked , taking [his]116-major sholto cheroot from [his]116-major sholto lips .[693-i]

" [I]693-i wanted to ask [you]116-major sholto , [sir]765-sir , said [I]693-i , who is [the proper person to whom hidden treasure should be handed over]1979-the proper person to whom hidden treasure should be handed over . [I]693-i know where half a million worth lies , and , as [I]693-i can not use it [myself]693-i , [I]693-i thought perhaps the best thing that [I]693-i could do would be to hand it over to [the proper authorities]1980-the proper authorities , and then perhaps [they]1980-the proper authorities would get [my]693-i sentence shortened for [me]693-i .[693-i]

" Half a million , [Small]1981-small ? [he]116-major sholto gasped , looking hard at [me]693-i to see if [I]693-i was in earnest .[693-i]

" Quite that , [sir]765-sir , in jewels and pearls . It lies there ready for any one . And the queer thing about it is that [the real owner]1983-the real owner is outlawed and can not hold property , so that it belongs to [the first comer]1984-the first comer .[693-i]

" To government , [Small]118-jonathan small , [he]116-major sholto stammered , to government . But [he]116-major sholto said it in a halting fashion , and [I]693-i knew in [my]693-i heart that [I]693-i had got [him]116-major sholto .[693-i]

" [You]116-major sholto think , then , [sir]765-sir , that [I]693-i should give the information to [the Governor - General]1986-the governor - general ? said [I]693-i , quietly .[693-i]

" Well , well , [you]116-major sholto must not do anything rash , or that [you]116-major sholto might repent . Let [me]693-i hear all about it , [Small]1987-small . Give [me]693-i the facts .[693-i]

" [I]693-i told [him]116-major sholto the whole story , with small changes so that [he]116-major sholto could not identify the places . When [I]693-i had finished [he]116-major sholto stood stock still and full of thought . [I]693-i could see by the twitch of [his]116-major sholto lip that there was a struggle going on within [him]116-major sholto .[693-i]

" This is a very important matter , [Small]118-jonathan small , [he]116-major sholto said , at last . [You]118-jonathan small must not say a word to [any one about it]1988-any one about it , and [I]693-i shall see [you]118-jonathan small again soon .[693-i]

" Two nights later [he]116-major sholto and [[his]116-major sholto friend]1989-his friend [Captain Morstan]115-captain morstan came to [[my]693-i hut]1965-my hut in the dead of the night with a lantern .[693-i]

" [I]693-i want [you]118-jonathan small just to let [Captain Morstan]115-captain morstan hear that story from [your]118-jonathan small own lips , [Small]118-jonathan small , said [he]116-major sholto .[693-i]

" [I]693-i repeated it as [I]693-i had told it before .[693-i]

" It rings true , eh ? said [he]116-major sholto . It s good enough to act upon ?[693-i]

" [Captain Morstan]115-captain morstan nodded .[693-i]

" Look here , [Small]118-jonathan small , said [the major]800-the major . [We]1992-we have been talking it over , [[my]693-i friend]1445-my friend here and [I]693-i , and [we]1992-we have come to the conclusion that this secret of [yours]118-jonathan small is hardly a government matter , after all , but is a private concern of [your]118-jonathan small own , which of course [you]118-jonathan small have the power of disposing of as [you]118-jonathan small think best . Now , the question is , what price would [you]118-jonathan small ask for it ? [We]1992-we might be inclined to take it up , and at least look into it , if [we]1992-we could agree as to terms . [He]116-major sholto tried to speak in a cool , careless way , but [his]116-major sholto eyes were shining with excitement and greed .[693-i]

" Why , as to that , [gentlemen]876-gentlemen , [I]693-i answered , trying also to be cool , but feeling as excited as [he]116-major sholto did , there is only one bargain which [a man in [my]693-i position]1995-a man in my position can make . [I]693-i shall want [you]876-gentlemen to help [me]693-i to [my]693-i freedom , and to help [[my]693-i three companions]1996-my three companions to [theirs]1996-my three companions . [We]1992-we shall then take [you]876-gentlemen into partnership , and give [you]876-gentlemen a fifth share to divide between [you]876-gentlemen .[693-i]

" Hum ! said [he]116-major sholto . A fifth share ! That is not very tempting .[693-i]

" It would come to fifty thousand apiece , said [I.]693-i[693-i]

" But how can [we]1992-we gain [your]876-gentlemen freedom ? [You]876-gentlemen know very well that [you]876-gentlemen ask an impossibility .[693-i]

" Nothing of the sort , [I]693-i answered . [I]693-i have thought it all out to the last detail . The only bar to [our]1992-we escape is that [we]1992-we can get [no boat]1997-no boat fit for the voyage , and no provisions to last [us]1992-we for so long a time . There are plenty of [little yachts]1998-little yachts and yawls at [Calcutta]101-calcutta or [Madras]96-madras which would serve [our]1992-we turn well . Do [you]876-gentlemen bring one over . [We]1992-we shall engage to get aboard [her]1999-her by night , and if [you]876-gentlemen will drop [us]1992-we on [any part of [the Indian coast]2001-the indian coast]2000-any part of the indian coast [you]876-gentlemen will have done [your]876-gentlemen part of the bargain .[693-i]

" If there were only one , [he]876-gentlemen said .[693-i]

" None or all , [I]693-i answered . [We]1992-we have sworn it . [The four of [us]1992-we]2002-the four of us must always act together .[693-i]

" [You]693-i see , [Morstan]115-captain morstan , said [he]876-gentlemen , [Small]118-jonathan small is [a man]736-a man of [his]118-jonathan small word . [He]118-jonathan small does not flinch from [[his]118-jonathan small friend]1989-his friend . [I]693-i think [we]1992-we may very well trust [him]118-jonathan small .[693-i]

" It s a dirty business , [the other]1575-the other answered . Yet , as [you]693-i say , the money would save [our]1992-we commissions handsomely .[693-i]

" Well , [Small]2006-small , said [the major]800-the major , [we]1992-we must , [I]693-i suppose , try and meet [you]2006-small . [We]1992-we must first , of course , test the truth of [your]2006-small story . Tell [me]693-i where the box is hid , and [I]693-i shall get leave of absence and go back to [India]26-india in [the monthly relief - boat]2008-the monthly relief - boat to inquire into the affair .[693-i]

" Not so fast , said [I]693-i , growing colder as [he]693-i got hot . [I]693-i must have the consent of [[my]693-i three comrades]2009-my three comrades . [I]693-i tell [you]2006-small that it is four or none with [us]1992-we .[693-i]

" Nonsense ! [he]693-i broke in . What have [three black fellows]2010-three black fellows to do with [our]1992-we agreement ?[693-i]

" Black or blue , said [I]693-i , [they]2010-three black fellows are in with [me]693-i , and [we]1992-we all go together .[693-i]

" Well , the matter ended by a second meeting , at which [Mahomet Singh]119-mahomet singh , [Abdullah Khan]120-abdullah khan , and [Dost Akbar]121-dost akbar were all present . [We]1992-we talked the matter over again , and at last [we]1992-we came to an arrangement . [We]1992-we were to provide both [the officers]1161-the officers with charts of [the part of [the Agra fort]2013-the agra fort]2012-the part of the agra fort and mark the place in the wall where the treasure was hid . [Major Sholto]116-major sholto was to go to [India]26-india to test [our]1992-we story . If [he]116-major sholto found the box [he]116-major sholto was to leave it there , to send out [a small yacht provisioned for a voyage]2014-a small yacht provisioned for a voyage , which was to lie off [Rutland Island]59-rutland island , and to which [we]1992-we were to make [our]1992-we way , and finally to return to [his]116-major sholto duties . [Captain Morstan]115-captain morstan was then to apply for leave of absence , to meet [us]1992-we at [Agra]87-agra , and there [we]1992-we were to have a final division of the treasure , [he]115-captain morstan taking [the major]800-the major s share as well as [his]115-captain morstan own . All this [we]1992-we sealed by the most solemn oaths that [the mind]2016-the mind could think or the lips utter . [I]693-i sat up all night with paper and ink , and by the morning [I]693-i had the two charts all ready , signed with the sign of four , that is , of [Abdullah]120-abdullah khan , [Akbar]121-dost akbar , [Mahomet]119-mahomet singh , and [myself]693-i .[693-i]

" Well , [gentlemen]876-gentlemen , [I]693-i weary [you]876-gentlemen with [my]693-i long story , and [I]693-i know that [[my]693-i friend]1445-my friend [Mr. Jones]109-jones is impatient to get [me]693-i safely stowed in chokey . [I]693-i ll make it as short as [I]693-i can . [The villain]2019-the villain [Sholto]116-major sholto went off to [India]26-india , but [he]116-major sholto never came back again . [Captain Morstan]115-captain morstan showed [me]693-i [his]116-major sholto name among a list of passengers in one of [the mail - boats]2020-the mail - boats very shortly afterwards . [[His]116-major sholto uncle]2021-his uncle had died , leaving [him]116-major sholto a fortune , and [he]116-major sholto had left [the army]1641-the army , yet [he]116-major sholto could stoop to treat [five men]2023-five men as [he]116-major sholto had treated [us]2024-we . [Morstan]115-captain morstan went over to [Agra]87-agra shortly afterwards , and found , as [we]2024-we expected , that the treasure was indeed gone . [The scoundrel]2025-the scoundrel had stolen it all , without carrying out one of the conditions on which [we]2024-we had sold [him]116-major sholto the secret . From that day [I]693-i lived only for vengeance . [I]693-i thought of it by day and [I]693-i nursed it by night . It became an overpowering , absorbing passion with [me]693-i . [I]693-i cared nothing for the law , nothing for the gallows . To escape , to track down [Sholto]116-major sholto , to have [my]693-i hand upon [his]116-major sholto throat , that was [my]693-i one thought . Even the Agra treasure had come to be a smaller thing in [my]693-i mind than the slaying of [Sholto]116-major sholto .[693-i]

" Well , [I]693-i have set [my]693-i mind on many things in this life , and never one which [I]693-i did not carry out . But it was weary years before [my]693-i time came . [I]693-i have told [you]2026-you that [I]693-i had picked up something of medicine . One day when [Dr. Somerton]193-dr. somerton was down with a fever a little Andaman [Islander]169-the islander was picked up by [a convict - gang in [the woods]2028-the woods]2027-a convict - gang in the woods . [He]169-the islander was sick to death , and had gone to [a lonely place to die]2029-a lonely place to die . [I]693-i took [him]169-the islander in hand , though [he]169-the islander was as venomous as a young snake , and after a couple of months [I]693-i got [him]169-the islander all right and able to walk . [He]169-the islander took a kind of fancy to [me]693-i then , and would hardly go back to [[his]169-the islander woods]2030-his woods , but was always hanging about [[my]693-i hut]1965-my hut . [I]693-i learned a little of [his]169-the islander lingo from [him]169-the islander , and this made [him]169-the islander all the fonder of [me]693-i .[693-i]

" [Tonga]2032-tonga for that was [his]2032-tonga name was [a fine boatman]2033-a fine boatman , and owned [a big , roomy canoe of [his]2032-tonga own]2034-a big , roomy canoe of his own . When [I]693-i found that [he]2032-tonga was devoted to [me]693-i and would do anything to serve [me]693-i , [I]693-i saw [my]693-i chance of escape . [I]693-i talked it over with [him]2032-tonga . [He]2032-tonga was to bring [[his]2032-tonga boat]635-his boat round on a certain night to [an old wharf which was never guarded]2036-an old wharf which was never guarded , and there [he]2032-tonga was to pick [me]693-i up . [I]693-i gave [him]2032-tonga directions to have several gourds of water and a lot of yams , cocoa - nuts , and sweet potatoes .[693-i]

" [He]2032-tonga was stanch and true , was [little Tonga]171-tonga . [No man]1839-no man ever had [a more faithful mate]2038-a more faithful mate . At the night named [he]2032-tonga had [[his]2032-tonga boat]635-his boat at [the wharf]499-the wharf . As it chanced , however , there was [one of [the convict - guard down there]2042-the convict - guard down there]2041-one of the convict - guard down there , [a vile Pathan who had never missed a chance of insulting and injuring [me]693-i]2043-a vile pathan who had never missed a chance of insulting and injuring me . [I]693-i had always vowed vengeance , and now [I]693-i had [my]693-i chance . It was as if fate had placed [him]2032-tonga in [my]693-i way that [I]693-i might pay [my]693-i debt before [I]693-i left [the island]2044-the island . [He]2032-tonga stood on [the bank]638-the bank with [his]2032-tonga back to [me]693-i , and [his]2032-tonga carbine on [his]2032-tonga shoulder . [I]693-i looked about for a stone to beat out [his]2032-tonga brains with , but none could [I]693-i see . Then a queer thought came into [my]693-i head and showed [me]693-i where [I]693-i could lay [my]693-i hand on a weapon . [I]693-i sat down in the darkness and unstrapped [my]693-i wooden leg . With three long hops [I]693-i was on [him]2032-tonga . [He]2032-tonga put [his]2032-tonga carbine to [his]2032-tonga shoulder , but [I]693-i struck [him]2032-tonga full , and knocked the whole front of [his]2032-tonga skull in . [You]2046-you can see the split in the wood now where [I]693-i hit [him]2032-tonga . [We]2047-we both went down together , for [I]693-i could not keep [my]693-i balance , but when [I]693-i got up [I]693-i found [him]2032-tonga still lying quiet enough . [I]693-i made for [the boat]1338-the boat , and in an hour [we]2047-we were well out at [sea]2049-sea . [Tonga]171-tonga had brought all [his]2032-tonga earthly possessions with [him]2032-tonga , [his]2032-tonga arms and [[his]2032-tonga gods]2050-his gods . Among other things , [he]2032-tonga had a long bamboo spear , and some Andaman cocoa - nut matting , with which [I]693-i made a sort of sail . For ten days [we]2047-we were beating about , trusting to luck , and on the eleventh [we]2047-we were picked up by [a trader which was going from [Singapore]102-singapore to [Jiddah]103-jiddah with a cargo of [Malay pilgrims]2052-malay pilgrims]2051-a trader which was going from singapore to jiddah with a cargo of malay pilgrims . [They]2051-a trader which was going from singapore to jiddah with a cargo of malay pilgrims were [a rum crowd]2053-a rum crowd , and [Tonga]171-tonga and [I]693-i soon managed to settle down among [them]2051-a trader which was going from singapore to jiddah with a cargo of malay pilgrims . [They]2051-a trader which was going from singapore to jiddah with a cargo of malay pilgrims had one very good quality : [they]2051-a trader which was going from singapore to jiddah with a cargo of malay pilgrims let [you]2054-you alone and asked no questions .[693-i]

" Well , if [I]693-i were to tell [you]2054-you all the adventures that [[my]693-i little chum]2055-my little chum and [I]693-i went through , [you]2054-you would not thank [me]693-i , for [I]693-i would have [you]2054-you here until the sun was shining . Here and there [we]2056-we drifted about [the world]706-the world , something always turning up to keep [us]2056-we from [London]8-london . All the time , however , [I]693-i never lost sight of [my]693-i purpose . [I]693-i would dream of [Sholto]116-major sholto at night . A hundred times [I]693-i have killed [him]116-major sholto in [my]693-i sleep . At last , however , some three or four years ago , [we]2056-we found [ourselves]2056-we in [England]6-england . [I]693-i had no great difficulty in finding where [Sholto]116-major sholto lived , and [I]693-i set to work to discover whether [he]116-major sholto had realised the treasure , or if [he]116-major sholto still had it . [I]693-i made [friends]956-friends with someone who could help [me]693-i , [I]693-i name no names , for [I]693-i don t want to get any one else in a hole , and [I]693-i soon found that [he]116-major sholto still had the jewels . Then [I]693-i tried to get at [him]116-major sholto in many ways ; but [he]116-major sholto was pretty sly , and had always [two prize - fighters]914-two prize - fighters , besides [[his]116-major sholto sons]2060-his sons and [[his]116-major sholto khitmutgar]2061-his khitmutgar , on guard over [him]116-major sholto .[693-i]

" One day , however , [I]693-i got word that [he]116-major sholto was dying . [I]693-i hurried at once to [the garden]944-the garden , mad that [he]116-major sholto should slip out of [my]693-i clutches like that , and , looking through the window , [I]693-i saw [him]116-major sholto lying in [his]116-major sholto bed , with [[his]116-major sholto sons]2060-his sons on each side of [him]116-major sholto . [I]693-i d have come through and taken [my]693-i chance with [the three of [them]2064-the three of them]2064-the three of them , only even as [I]693-i looked at [him]116-major sholto [his]116-major sholto jaw dropped , and [I]693-i knew that [he]116-major sholto was gone . [I]693-i got into [[his]116-major sholto room]927-his room that same night , though , and [I]693-i searched [his]116-major sholto papers to see if there was any record of where [he]116-major sholto had hidden [our]2066-we jewels . There was not a line , however : so [I]693-i came away , bitter and savage as [a man]736-a man could be . Before [I]693-i left [I]693-i bethought [me]693-i that if [I]693-i ever met [[my]693-i Sikh friends]2068-my sikh friends again it would be a satisfaction to know that [I]693-i had left some mark of [our]2066-we hatred ; so [I]693-i scrawled down the sign of the four of [us]2066-we , as it had been on the chart , and [I]693-i pinned it on [his]116-major sholto bosom . It was too much that [he]116-major sholto should be taken to the grave without some token from [the men whom [he]116-major sholto had robbed and befooled]2069-the men whom he had robbed and befooled . "[693-i]

" [We]2066-we earned a living at this time by [my]693-i exhibiting poor Tonga at fairs and other such places as [the black cannibal]2070-the black cannibal . [He]116-major sholto would eat raw meat and dance [his]116-major sholto war - dance : so [we]2066-we always had a hatful of pennies after a day s work . [I]693-i still heard all the news from [Pondicherry Lodge]25-pondicherry lodge , and for some years there was no news to hear , except that [they]25-pondicherry lodge were hunting for the treasure . At last , however , came what [we]2066-we had waited for so long . The treasure had been found . It was up at [the top of [the house]296-the house]2071-the top of the house , in [[Mr. Bartholomew Sholto]138-bartholomew sholto s chemical laboratory]2073-mr. bartholomew sholto s chemical laboratory . [I]693-i came at once and had a look at [the place]1134-the place , but [I]693-i could not see how with [my]693-i wooden leg [I]693-i was to make [my]693-i way up to [it]1134-the place . [I]693-i learned , however , about a trap - door in the roof , and also about [Mr. Sholto]138-bartholomew sholto s supper - hour . It seemed to [me]693-i that [I]693-i could manage the thing easily through [Tonga]171-tonga . [I]693-i brought [him]138-bartholomew sholto out with [me]693-i with a long rope wound round [his]138-bartholomew sholto waist . [He]138-bartholomew sholto could climb like a cat , and [he]138-bartholomew sholto soon made [his]138-bartholomew sholto way through the roof , but , as ill luck would have it , [Bartholomew Sholto]138-bartholomew sholto was still in [the room]206-the room , to [his]138-bartholomew sholto cost . [Tonga]2076-tonga thought [he]138-bartholomew sholto had done something very clever in killing [him]138-bartholomew sholto , for when [I]693-i came up by the rope [I]693-i found [him]138-bartholomew sholto strutting about as proud as a peacock . Very much surprised was [he]138-bartholomew sholto when [I]693-i made at [him]138-bartholomew sholto with the rope s end and cursed [him]138-bartholomew sholto for [a little blood - thirsty imp]2077-a little blood - thirsty imp . [I]693-i took the treasure - box and let it down , and then slid down [myself]693-i , having first left the sign of the four upon the table , to show that the jewels had come back at last to [those who had most right to [them]2079-them]2078-those who had most right to them . [Tonga]2080-tonga then pulled up the rope , closed the window , and made off the way that [he]138-bartholomew sholto had come . "[693-i]

" [I]109-jones don t know that [I]109-jones have anything else to tell [you]2081-you .
